Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio, ofrecer mas variedad de tejidos a sus clientelas así obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de materia prima para la compra de materia prima para tejidos
texts.en:
"Solidario Trabajando con Cristo" Lending Group:

Margarita is a native of the village of Pacorral.  She is 42 years old, and has eight children under her care.  She works weaving traditional fabrics by hand, as well as farming.  Her husband works as a farmer, and thanks to the support of him and their family, she continues ahead with her business.  

The previous loan that she received was used to purchase more thread for her weaving, and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fungicides for her agricultural work.  She dreams of expanding her business and offering her customers a larger variety of woven fabrics, so that she can improve her earnings and send her children to school so that they may have a better future.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase raw materials for her weaving.

loans.use: purchase raw material for weaving.

loans.name: Manya

texts.en: Manya is from Nor Kesaria village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and is a mother of two children ages 25 and 21 years old. Manya's husband and son are conventional workers in the army so they are rarely at home. To help support the family, Manya has been involved in agriculture. Her farm is small and she only cultivates onions and keeps five calves. Manya, as a hard-working woman, feels very responsible for maintaining a sustainable farm. By applying for this loan of USD $1,500 Manya asks support from Kiva lenders to purchase onion seeds, two oxen and forage for the livestock. The loan will be a big support for Manya and she will be able to increase her income from agriculture. Manya hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for onion seeds, two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, who deals in selling second-hand clothes and farming in the village, repaid her previous loan well. She sells her clothes and animal products, such as milk to people around her village and neighboring areas.

She hopes to use the loan to pay school fees for her children and dependents. She has hopes of enlarging her business so that she can attract a wider market.

She faces a challenge of some goods that are seasonal, meaning that when the season elapses, the market also disappears. She is described as an honest and hardworking lady. She appreciates lenders for enabling her to develop herself and her family because of the financial services provided.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Майрам замужняя женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она мама троих детей. У нее два старших сына и дочка. Ее муж работает строителем, сыновья находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Майрам около 6 лет занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Она любит проводить время, ухаживая за скотами, потому что она любит животных. Для Майрам данная деятельность является и любимым занятием и доходным бизнесом. На сегодняшний день у нее мало скотов. Но для покупки достаточного количество скота у нее не хватает средства, и она решилась взять кредит и увеличить количество скотин. С надеждой на то, что ей помогут.
texts.en: Mayram is 50, married, and the mother of three children. She has two older sons and a daughter. Her husband is a construction worker and her sons are working in Russia. Mayram has about six years of experience in animal husbandry. She loves animals and spending time caring for cattle. It is her favorite pastime and a profitable business. She does not have many cattle right now and does not have the money to buy more. She decided to take out a loan to buy more cattle. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: María Nubia

texts.es:
María es una microempresaria dedicada a su labor y a su familia, desde hace más de 10 años, inició su proyecto productivo, un pequeño taller de confección que inicialmente ubicó en un espacio pequeño de su casa y contaba con dos máquinas, poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientes y contratos, por lo que se vio obligada a aumentar su capacidad instalada y hoy en día cuenta con 13 máquinas y tiene varios empleados directos, trabaja todos los días con el ánimo de generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues comprará insumos al por mayor (hilos, telas, botones) y cancelará el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente, así podrá terminar la producción que tiene pendiente y entregarla de manera oportuna a sus clientes y estará en la capacidad de adquirir nuevos contratos para darle continuidad a su labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, para así lograr que sus empleados cuenten con todas las prestaciones sociales de ley y un contrato de trabajo continuo y estable; así mejorará tanto la calidad de vida familiar, como la de sus empleados.
texts.en:
María is a small business owner who is dedicated to her job and her family.  She started her business over ten years ago.  Her business is a small sewing shop that began in a small space in her home with two machines, but little by little, she gained more customers and contracts, and she had to expand.  She now has 13 machines and a few employees.  She works everyday with the goal of earning an income to help her husband with the household finances.

The loan that she is seeking will be helpful in strengthening her business.  She will use it to purchase supplies in bulk (thread, fabrics, buttons), and pay off the balance of the loan that she currently has.  This will allow her to finish the orders that she has pending, and deliver them in a timely manner to her customers.  She will then be in a position to take on new contracts to continue her business.  

María states that her biggest challenge is making her business more profitable so that she can ensure that her employees have all of their legal benefits, and a continuous and stable working contract.  Through this, she will be able to greatly improve her family's quality of life as well as that of her employees.

loans.use: purchase supplies in bulk (thread, fabrics, buttons), and pay of the balance off the loan that she currently has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, tissues, milk, bread, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Abad

texts.es:
Abad vive en compañia de sus padres y hermanos  en la zona de Caja Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como oficial de creditos en una institucion financiera, Abad nos solicito el crédito para efectuar pago de sus estudios superiores.

El sueño de Abad es culminar con sus estudios profesionales y formar una familia,
texts.en: Abad lives with his parents and siblings in the Caja Ferroviaria district of the city of La Paz.  He works as a loan officer in a financial institution.  Abad is seeking this loan to pay for his higher education costs.  Abad's dream is to finish his professional studies and start a family.

loans.use: continue to pay for his university education.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es una joven emprendedora y trabajador que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, él desde hace varios años pertenece al banco comunal "Siempre Juntos" y en esta oportunidad requiere otro préstamo o adicional para incrementar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más cuyes. David se siente contento por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
David is a young entrepreneur and worker who is dedicated to raising small animals like guinea pigs.  For the past few years, he has been a member of the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank.  At the moment, he is in need of another loan to increase his business's capital in order to purchase more guinea pigs.  

David is very happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments on schedule and responsibly.  He is thankful to the lenders for the loan and hopes that they continue to support other projects.

loans.use: purchase more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jentrix's Group

texts.en:
Jentrix is a member of this group in Chwele District. She is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 75 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Jentrix has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Jentrix is 45 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her 5 children. The community and other farmers know Jentrix as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community groups, such as the women's group. Jentrix described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Jentrix joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods and earn enough to feed her family. Because she is an active community member, she wants to help more farmers in her community. Jentrix has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved her life because she has more farm training and was able to save money. In the future, Jentrix hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and to invest in a business. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Jentrix and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Festus' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 3 group leader farmers in Busia District, with Festus selected as the Kiva representative.  Festus has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is shown in the photo.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 26 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  All of the individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Festus is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 6 children.  Festus is 63 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, he is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  His harvest last year was not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year in the program!
														
The 2014 Long Rains season will be Festus’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  As an active member in his community, Festus also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Festus plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.							
 							
Festus and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing at the left in the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Magdaline's Group

texts.en:
Magdaline, 52, is married and has five children (she is standing on the right with her hand raised). She is known as a friendly and hardworking woman. In the past three years she has become an experienced farmer. She is active in her community, belonging to such groups as a women's group, prayer group and burial committee.

Magdaline is a member of this One Acre Fund, or OAF, group in Busia District. She and the seven others pictured here are OAF group leaders (the field officer is standing on the left). These leaders represent a total of 72 OAF farmers. She and the other farmers belonging to this group will each receive ¼ acre’s worth of maize seed and ¼ acre’s worth of millet or sorghum seed, plus fertilizer.

Magdaline joined OAF in order to get the best price on seed, learn new farming methods and earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about OAF farmers. She received help through OAF last year but did not get as desirable a yield as she would have liked. She believes, however, that she can have a better harvest this year by continuing to work with OAF.

Magdaline and her group are applying for a 385,128 KES loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing seed and fertilizer through OAF. It pre-purchases seed and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the savings on to the farmers. On average they will receive a loan of 5,349 KES each. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, OAF also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to OAF. The Fund will also repay the members’ Kiva loan out of the farmers’ profits.

Magdaline plans to use the money she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. She notes that working with OAF has led to many benefits for its farmers. With support from OAF and your Kiva loan, farmers such as Magdaline will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives in Argina village with her husband and two daughters. Her daughter attends a local village school and Liana together with her husband is engaged in agriculture. Particularly they keep a livestock of cows, sheep, and calves as well as cultivate some limited grass as forage for the livestock. The farm isn't big, but the couple works hard to run it in a sustainable way to ensure better living conditions for their daughters.

Now Liana has applied for this loan of USD 1,000 to purchase two oxen and forage for the livestock. The loan will be a huge support for Liana and her husband as they are currently facing financial difficulties and have no opportunity for expanding the farm.  

Liana hopes that lenders will assist her to make her dream to come true: to have a big and profitable farm.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for the livestock

Serila described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Serila joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Serila joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed her family.  Because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers, Sirila wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Serila has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Serila's life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Serila hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and invest in a business.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Serila and the Amua GRP Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жазгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жазгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жазгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 4 кобылы, 29 овец, 30 коз. С марта по ноябрь месяцы Жазгул продает молочные продукты, такие как: топленое масло, курут, кефир. Супруг посезонно работает частным строителем. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jazgul is 33 years old and married. She and her husband are raising four children. Jazgul has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Jazgul raises livestock, having launched this business 14 years ago by buying livestock for 4,000 KGS. Thanks to Jazgul’s hard work, her farm now includes eight dairy cows, four mares, 29 sheep, and 30 goats. From March to November, Jazgul sells dairy product such as baked milk, “kurut” [a traditional   dried dairy by-product], and kefir [fermented milk product]. Jazgul’s husband works on private construction sites in season. Jazgul’s monthly income is 14,000 KGS. IN order to develop her farm further, Jazgul has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in order to increase her livestock headcount by buying cows. She plans to use her resulting income for an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save for her children’s further education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr:
Agée de 23 ans, Essénam est célibataire avec 2 enfants en charge et habite Lomé capitale du Togo, quartier Adidogomé. Depuis 2011, elle a débuté son commerce d’alimentation générale avec  l’aide financière de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier une fois par semaine et est donc obligée de ne pas exposer ses produits lorsqu'elle se déplace pour faire l’approvisionnement.  
Apres avoir suivi la formation sur comment maximiser ses gains organisée par Assilassimé, elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock d’huile, riz et de détergent. Elle pourra réduire sa fréquence  d’approvisionnement de 4 à 2 fois par mois.  Ainsi elle passera plus de temps devant sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Aged 23, Essénam is single, raising two children and living in Lomé, the capital of Togo, in the district of Adidogomé. In 2011, she opened her little general store with financial help from her family. She buys her merchandise in the market in her district once a week and is thus obliged to refrain from displaying her goods when she goes to restock her store. 

After having attended a seminar organized by Assilassimé on how to maximize her profits, she is requesting this loan to grow her stock of oil, rice and detergent. She will then be able to restock twice a month instead of four times a month, which means she will be able to spend more time displaying and selling her goods.

loans.use: to buy two jerrycans of vegetable oil and two sacks of rice

loans.name: Muzamiru

texts.en:
Muzamiru is a married man with two children, ages four and two respectively. He is described as an honest and hard-working man. He works in a trading center where he owns a retail shop. He works seven days a week, 15 hours a day. He also deals in produce, which he started doing in 2012 so as to get extra income.

He sells his products to people and students around his community and neighboring areas. He hopes to use the loan to boost his retail business. His dream is to turn his retail business into a wholesale business, which will bring in more clients and more profits. However, he faces the challenges of price fluctuation, high taxes and lack of capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy retail stock to sell.

loans.name: Fiday

texts.en:
Fiday is a taxi driver. He is 41 years old and married, and he has two children. One of them is going to ninth class, and the other is going to seventh class of school. His wife is a housewife and doesn’t work on incoming business. They are living in Abseron region, but 21 years ago they became Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from their home, which was Zangilan city.

Fiday is a taxi driver. A while ago, his car was crashed. The car is seen in this picture. Today, he needs a loan in the amount of 800 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN), to repair his car. Fiday is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for their help.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Aregnazan

texts.en:
Aregnazan lives with her husband in Arevadasht village, in Armavir region. She works at a local kindergarten, and she also runs a farm. The farm currently includes 15 cows, 34 chickens and some calves. Near their house, Aregnazan and her husband cultivate haricots and grass. Unfortunately, the barn that they own is too old, and it is already impossible to keep animals there. So, the loan that Aregnazan is now requesting is highly important for renovating the barn and improving husbandry conditions.

Aregnazan will be very grateful to the lenders who will support her loan, of USD 1500. She hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking gas package in order to preserve the environment

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Aygevan village with her family: parents, brother and sister. Ruzanna is a nurse by profession, and works part-time at a regional clinic. Together with her family, Ruzanna has also been engaged in agriculture for years. The farm they own includes 2 cows, 2 pigs, and 25 chickens. The family also cultivates tomatoes, haricots and grass, and they grow 50 apricot trees. Ruzanna, despite her young age, helps her parents with great love and pleasure. She loves agricultural work.

Now, by asking for this loan of USD 3000, Ruzanna will be able to enlarge their farm by buying 2 pigs, forage for the livestock, fertilizer and seeds. Some part of the loan will also be used to cover cultivation costs, so the loan will be a huge support for Ruzanna and her agribusiness.

Please help this hardworking woman to enrich her farm and gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs, livestock feed, fertilizer and seeds, and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir junto a su esposa se dican a la elaboracion y venta de quesos el cual vende a las ferias de achacachi, Ademas trabaja como maestro albañil. vive en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos   en la comunidad cala cala del municipio de Achacachi, a dos   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche.

El credito requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y asi, incrementara su produccion, y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Vladimir es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción de quesos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Vladmir and his wife work on the production and sale of cheeses which they sell at fairs in the city of Achacachi. He also works as a brick layer. They live in their own house with their two children in Cala Cala, a community located within the city of Achacachi, two hours from La Paz. They have a few heads of cattle that produce milk. He requires a loan to buy a dairy cow which will allow him to increase production and income. Vladmir's dream is to increase his heads of cattle thereby increasing the production of cheeses in his community.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 41-year-old woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her husband works as a carpenter and she  sells snacks like puto (rice cakes) and cassava suman (cassava delicacy wrapped in leaves or palm leaves and steamed). Gloria hopes that she can improve her business and add different kinds of snacks to sell. She asks for a loan to buy flour and sugar. 

Gloria is determined to continue working hard for her family. She hopes to send her children to school and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es:
Francisca de 64 años de edad, soltero con tres hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de león  lugar  que está ubicado en  la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos  como pantalones jeans, faldas, blusas, short, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa de niño jugos de toallas, perfumes, labiales, rubor, sombra de ojos, lapiz delineador, marbelline. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Francisca, who is 64 years old, is single and has three adult children. She is from León, which is located in the western region of the country. She is known to be hardworking and responsible, and driven to improve herself. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to go to school  due to lacking financial resources and had to start working when she was very young in order to help out with household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her motivation to get ahead, she has a business selling new clothing and cosmetics. She sells jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts, linens, children's clothing, towels, fragrances, lipstick, rouge, eye shadow, eyeliner, and other items. She dedicates around ten hours a day to her business by offering her products as a street vendor. She has regular and occasional customers.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling new clothing so that in the near future she can obtain better earnings. Francisca is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua for them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to stock up on cosmetics and new clothing items.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 51 years old and married with six school-aged children.  

She sells a variety of merchandise to her locality.  She is known in the community as a loving person.  She requests 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and spices for her store.  This will help her to generate more income.

She hopes that her business will improve so that she can meet her family's needs and be able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and spices for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precilla is 53 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking person. Every morning, she sells vegetables and fruits to the community.

Precilla asks for 10,000 PHP to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, mangos and bananas for her business.

In the future, Pecilla hopes that she can build her own stall in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, mangos and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Chunima Group

texts.en:
Chunima is a small rural community located in a remote area of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. The community is difficult to get to as public transportation is scarce. Most people walk for many miles to get anywhere, including on main thoroughfares.

Recently in Chunima, a new Friendship Bridge Trust was formed consisting of nine ladies. The women honored their community by naming their Trust Bank Chunima. Their average age is 31 years and each averages three children. Most of them have only had two years of formal education. The ladies are very enthusiastic and excited because this is their very first loan cycle!

They understand that with careful planning and understanding of business and money practices, they will be able to grow their businesses. Besides learning about effective business management, they will receive other training during their monthly meetings given by Friendship Bridge staff on other topics like women’s leadership, women’s rights, identity and self esteem. Meetings are held in their own community of Chunima in their own native language.

Carmen has been elected President of the Trust Bank. She is 30 years old and since she has never held a position like this, she is a little nervous. But Carmen is also excited and is looking forward to being an efficient and informed officer. She is also requesting a loan which she will use to purchase more medicines for her little pharmacy which is a vital lifeline for this remote community. Carmen will also use part of her loan to purchase materials for creating fabrics. 

The nine hardworking women of the Chunima Trust Bank are anticipating a brighter future armed with the micro-loans and educational training provided by Friendship Bridge. They know that they must work hard and keep their goals in focus. They express their gratitude to KIVA investors for their confidence and generosity in funding their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for her little pharmacy.

loans.name: Juvy Ann

texts.en:
Juvy Ann  is 28 years old  and lives in Tagbilaran with her family. She is married with four children between the ages of two and nine. 

She has a thriving hog raising business which helps to support her family. She also sells cosmetics. Her business started three years ago and Juvy Ann wanted to expand. She asks for 7,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and cosmetics. 

She plans to continue investing in hog raising to make it even bigger and provide her family with a better future. In the future, she dreams of having a small farm too.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lourdes Vanesa

texts.es:
Lourdes, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de aceite, yuca, sal, harina, fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, lo que le da las herramientas para cultivar de una mejor manera granos básicos y seguir elaborando los diversos antojitos que vende.
EL préstamo anterior le ayudo a surtir su venta de ropa, con lo que tuvo mejores ventas y mayores ingresos los que ha utilizado para mejorar estilo de vida familiar y cancelar deudas, por el momento ella dejo de realizar esa actividad pero espera retomarla en un futuro, actualmente se dedica a vender antojitos y a la siembra de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is requesting a new loan to buy oil, yucca, salt, flour, fertilizers, pesticides and other tools she needs to better grow basic grains and to continue making the variety of homemade snacks she sells.

Her previous loan helped her to stock her clothing sales business and to increase her sales and income. She used the income to improve her family’s lifestyle and pay off debts. She has put her clothing business temporarily on hold, and hopes to start it again in the future. At the moment she is selling homemade snacks and growing basic grains.

loans.use: to buy oil, yucca, salt, flour, fertilizers and pesticides for her business.

loans.name: Lea Faith

texts.en:
Lea Faith is a 26-year-old woman from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has two children ages three and five. 

Six months ago, Lea Faith started a small eatery to sell home-cooked meals. She would like to add things that will further improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy a refrigerator, food storage boxes, and utensils. From this loan, she can hope to be more productive and run an efficient business. The additional income will be used to meet her family's daily needs and possibly open new business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, food storage boxes and utensils.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, necesita capital para pagar costos de la recolección de la cosecha, comprar insumos agrícolas y alimento para ganado; de esta manera fortalecerá su negocio pues por su experiencia en créditos sabe que si administra bien su inversión obtendrá mayores ganancias.
Para José el crédito anterior fue de gran ayuda porque su cosecha resulto ser abundante y libre de plagas, así mismo tuvo los recursos económicos para cubrir todo lo que el proceso de recolección implica como pago de mozos, transporte hacia su casa, etc., su situación económica es mucho más estable.
texts.en: José needs resources to pay for costs in harvesting his crops and to buy farm supplies and cattle feed. This way he can strengthen his business. From his loan experience, he knows that if you administer your investment well, you will receive higher profits. The previous loan was a great help for José because his resulting harvest was abundant and free of pests. Likewise, he had financial resources to be able to cover the harvest process such as payment for porters, transportation home, etc. His financial situation is much more stable.

loans.use: to pay costs for harvesting crop and to buy farm supplies and cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans for her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is requesting his second loan, this time for 3,000,000 shillings. Hi is single, 29 years old and lives in Ntinda village on the outskirts of a large city. He has a small boutique in Kampala which is located in a plaza building and has hired one person to help run it.  George attracts customers who are traveling to South Sudan and various parts of northern Uganda. He wants to stock his boutique to make it a one-stop shopping center, and plans to use this loan to make that happen. He also plans to repay the loan quickly, and is grateful for the excellent service he gets from UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconut oil and many other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y que desde hace varios años pertenece al banco comunal "Siempre Juntos" y en esta oportunidad requiere otro préstamo o adicional para incrementar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más cuyes. 

Maria se siente contento por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en: Maria is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who moves her family forward. For several years, she has belonged to the credit union, "Siempre Juntos" [Always Together]. This time, she requires another loan in order to increase the resources for her business and wants to buy more guinea pigs. Maria feels happy for the loan and promises to pay her installments responsibly and on time. She is thankful for all of the loan investors and hopes they continue to fund other projects.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, eggs, and corn for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milk, candy, rice, oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, bitter ball, etc to attract her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Maggi cubes, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, peppers, Vita, and many other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, cold water, cassava, ice, soft drinks, sugar, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado de básica en la escuela de su comunidad, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos de una relación anterior, pero no dependen de él.  Mario se dedica al trabajo en una granja de pollos el cual venden huevos y pollos trabaja ahí desde años,  el trabajo le queda a cinco minutos de su casa.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para iniciar el negocio de compra y venta de cerdos y pollos de engorde y ayudar a su compañera de vida a instalar un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mario is 36 years old. He went to his local school until the eighth grade. He is married, and his wife does the household work. He has two children from a previous relationship, but they are not his dependents. Mario works on a chicken farm that sells eggs and chickens. He has worked there for years. The farm is five minutes from his home.

Mario is requesting this loan to start a business of buying and selling pigs and broiler chickens, and also to help his wife start a clothing sales business.

loans.use: to start a business of buying and selling pigs and broiler chickens, and also to help his wife start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: La Creacion De Dios 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group La Creacion de Dios 1 & 2. The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. Santiago is known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry. 

Santa has 2 children and they live together with their father and her in a simple house. She is dedicated to working hard to save money and grow her business. She has been running her business around five years. She started selling empanadas (fried dough filled with meat), then she started taking loans with Esperanza International because she needed capital to increase her production to sell appetizers daily and for special events. She is excited to receive her sixth loan, which she will invest to buy various ingredients, goods (like flour, meat, butter, eggs, etc.), and plates, containers, dishes, etc. 

Santa will reinvest her profits in her business. She is dreaming to have a successful business where she can sells and cook for more events and bigger activities. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, butter, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of the group called Union y Desarrollo (Unite and Development) 1 & 2, located in the town of Hato Mayor, where their economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. She lives with her five children and her long-term partner. She enjoys being with her family, taking care of her children and attending to their needs.

Maritza has been selling clothes for around six years. She started her business with her own savings. She is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza International after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of clothing for women, men and kids, shoes, underwear, etc. Maritza plans to use her profits to invest in her business and continuing saving. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: El Progreso 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Bianca is one of the members of the group El Progreso 1, 2, 3 & 4, made up of 20 micro-business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. This is Bianca's second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth. She has had her business selling underwear for around five years. She started the business with her own resources.

Bianca is planning to invest her new loan towards purchasing underwear at wholesale. She is going to use her earnings to continue saving and increasing her inventory. She is dreaming of having an improved business in order to provide her children a better and safer life. She is a single mother with three children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children alone. She loves to watch television and to be with her children.

loans.use: To buy underwear for retail

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana brinda sus servicios en la elaboracion de mantas con máquina de coser,
moldes, reglas, tejieras, agujas, croché, cinta métrica, pesas, tizas de colores, etc.

Los moldes de cartón de 300 micras teniendo en cuenta las tallas y medidas, se usan reglas de patronaje, las telas se seleccionan de acuerdo al artículo y al modelo que se ha de confeccionar. Los tejidos artesanales como mantas o fajas son muy caras por lo que se utilizan sólo porciones de estos en determinados lugares del vestido, sólo como decoración y se procede a cortar la tela según el trazo realizado usando una tijera. Cuando se necesita una suficiente cantidad de piezas del mismo tamaño, por lo menos 10 a 15 paños, se utiliza una cortadora eléctrica manual para cortar todo el bloque según el trazo realizado encima.

Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en La Paz, aproximadamente a media hora del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Emiliana es exportar en un futuro a nivel naconal y con maquinas ya actualizadas, pues asi mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Emiliana provides tailoring services using a sewing machine, patterns, rulers, scissors, needles, crochet, measuring tape, weights, colored chalk, etc. She uses 300-micron cardboard patterns according to size and measurements, and follows the standards of pattern design. She chooses the best fabric for each item and style that is to be sewn. Traditional woven fabrics like the ones used for shawls and sashes are very expensive, which is why they are used only on certain parts of a dress exclusively as decoration. She uses scissors to cut the fabric following her drawing, but when enough pieces are needed in the same size, at least ten or fifteen lengths, she uses a manual electrical cutter to cut the whole pile following the lines drawn on top.

She lives in her own home in La Paz, approximately half an hour away from downtown La Paz.

Emiliana's dream is to export nationally in the future with updated machinery, so that her income and quality of life will improve.

This is the first time she requests a loan from IMPRO and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials and repair machinery.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, esta soltera, vive en casa de los padres, trabaja como secretaria en una institucion, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El credito que solicita es para pagar un curso de actualizacion ya que por la demanda de trabajos ella tiene miedo, y quiere actualizarce y capacitarse para mantener su trabajo.ya que no tiene otro ingreso..
 
El sueño de Lourdes es poder estudiar y tener una profesion.
texts.en:
Lourdes is single and lives in her parents’ house. She works as a secretary in a public institution. With this work she is able to support herself and cover her needs.

She is requesting this loan to pay for a legal refresher course. She is afraid because of the high demand for work. She wants to update her training and skills to keep her job, as she has no other source of income.

Lourdes dreams of being able to study to enter a profession.

loans.use: to pay for a legal refresher course.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and the father of two children aged 5 and 10. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him and helps out with the house chores. In 2003, Abdulai established a business where he sells various used items, including electronics, tires and carpet. He began his business to be self reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and he works seven days a week for 10 hours a day. He earns about Le 1,457,987 every month and is requesting a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy more items to sell. He hopes that this loan will increase his inventory and expand the business. In the future, Abdulai plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electronics for his shop

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, soltera y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que el préstamo le ha ayudado a mejorar la economía de su hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cosméticos y Ropa variada. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener ganancias para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Teresa is originally from the city of Managua. She is a single mother of three grown children. She is a merchant who sells clothing. She feels thankful for Kiva and MiCrédito. The loan has already helped her to improve her home finances. She requests this loan to buy cosmetics and assorted clothing. She thinks that this loan will help her a lot and she will be able to make income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and assorted clothing.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé au nord ouest de la capitale du Togo.  Elle est une femme dynamique qui a commencé le petit commerce de mèche, d’habit et fait la restauration du riz dans son quartier depuis 2005. Elle s’approvisionne en habit dans le marché de Hédzranawoé et en riz dans son quartier.  Au début de son activité, elle a été aidée par son mari avec un appui financier qui lui a permis de faire les premiers achats. Elle a par la suite suivi des formations sur la gestion à Assilassimé afin de mieux gérer son activité et dégager assez de revenus.
Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter  3 sacs de riz afin de diminuer les fréquences d’approvisionnement et ainsi gagner du temps pour maximiser ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Abla is a woman of 33, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in the Adidogomé district, in the northwest of the capital of Togo. She is a dynamic woman who began her little business braiding hair and selling clothing, and has been selling cooked rice in her neighborhood since 2005. 

Abla buys her clothing in the market in Hédzranawoé, and she buys rice in her neighborhood. When she was establishing her business, she was helped by her husband with financial support that allowed her to make her first purchases. Later on she attended training in business management in Assilassimé in order to run her business better and earn more income from it. 

This loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy three sacks of rice so as to make fewer trips to stock up and thus have more time to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice

loans.name: Dúo Carmen De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Carmen de San Pedro, la señora María del Carmen quien tiene una venta de gas propano en la colonia donde vive desde hace tres años. Doña María tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de más cilindros de gas ya que tiene varios pedidos de cilindros al día y los tambos que tiene no le alcanzan.  Cuenta incondicionalmente con su esposo y su sueño es llegar a ser una gran distribuidora en su colonia.esperando contar con su ayuda.
texts.en: María del Carmen belongs to Dúo Carmen de San Pedro. She sells propane gas in the neighborhood where she lives. She has been doing this for three years. María needs a loan in order to buy more gas cylinders because she is getting several orders a day and the tanks she has are not enough. She has her husband's unconditional support, and her dream is to become a great distributor in her neighborhood. She hopes to get the help she needs in order to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy propane gas.

loans.name: Victoria Rosario

texts.en:
Victoria Rosario is 56 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is a widow with 2 children.

To earn a living, Victoria Rosario is engaged in a room for rent business. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Victoria Rosario has requested a loan to construct an additional room for rent.

Victoria Rosario has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Victoria Rosario would like to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, nails, and paint to construct an additional room in her boarding house.

loans.name: Leoba

texts.en:
Leoba is 35 years old and lives in, Caatadman-Acasia, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children.

To earn a living Leoba has a computer shop business. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. Leoba has requested a loan to purchase additional computer units.

Leoba has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. Leoba would like to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units.

loans.name: Aracelys Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aracely de 31 años de edad, madres solteras con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos.  Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones jeans, faldas, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, medias. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto.  El negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante, todos los días recorre las calles de su localidad con un peso de unos 20 kg. Llevando sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Aracely agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para  tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Aracely, 31, is a single mom with one child to support.  She is originally from Nagarote, which is located in the western part of the region.  The people there are hardworking, responsible, and want to improve themselves.  In her free time she likes to play with her kids.  Unfortunately she wasn't able to go to college because she couldn't afford it.  Now she strives day after day to provide a better future for her children.  Thanks to her efforts and her drive to get ahead in life, she works selling new clothing such as pants, jeans, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and nylons.  She dedicates ten hours a day to her business, selling her products.  She is a mobile vendor and every day she goes around the streets of her community carrying 20 kg in weight of product to regular and potential customers.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and buy a stock of new clothing to sell so that in the not too distant future she can earn more income.  Aracely thanks Kiva investors for the help they offer people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a respectable job.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as pants, jeans, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and nylons to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and lives Catadman-Manga, Ozamiz City. Teresita is married with two children.

To earn a living, Teresita has a business selling cakes and pastries. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Teresita has a requested a loan for house improvements.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years.

In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and other materials for house improvements.

loans.name: Maristel

texts.en:
Maristel  is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child and one infant.

Maristel has a cellphone repair and accesories business, and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan to purchase an additional stock of cellphone accessories and units.

Maristel has been a member of PMPC for three months. 

In the future, Maristel hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of cellphone accessories and units

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Salamatu.  She is married and has 3 children aged 3, 4 and 14. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her, her younger sister, and she is helping her with her education.  In 1998, Salamatu established her cooking utensils business. She began her business just to be self reliant and cater for the needs of the children. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,469,725 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bowls, tea cups and plates. She hopes that this loan will improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand the business to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plates, dishes and sauce pots

loans.name: Vital Yovany

texts.es:
Vital, adquirió con el crédito anterior variedad de mercadería, lo que le ayudo a fortalecer la atienda y la venta ambulante en su vehículo, sus ingresos son mayores, el número de clientes a aumentado lo que le genera  mayores ventas, su familia se mantiene con el mismo núcleo familiar y actualmente viven en mejores circunstancias.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito con el fin de cubrir la nueva demanda de sus productos, lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, verduras, frutas, jabón, aceite, etc., con lo continuara trabajando para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Vital bought a variety of merchandise for his store and the vehicle he uses for selling from place to place. His income has improved, he has more customers, and he is making more sales. His family is the same size as before, and now they are living in better conditions.

He is requesting this new loan to cover the new demand for his products. He will buy basic grains, drinks, candy, vegetables, fruits, soap, oil, etc. He will use this merchandise to continue working so that he can meet his financial commitments.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, candy, vegetables, fruits, soap, oil, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay porters, to rent a plot of land, and to buy livestock, fertilizers, and weed-killers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: GENOVEVA se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno, vende leche, produce queso y trabaja muy duro en La Paz, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno. Ella tiene casa propia y esta orgullosa de haberla conseguido con el trabajo duro, ademas ella aprovecha que es soltera y que no tiene hijos para poder hacer crecer su negocio y ahorrar
texts.en: Genoveva works very hard raising cattle, selling milk and making cheese. She lives in La Paz. She is requesting this loan to buy cattle. She has her own house, and is proud of having achieved that through hard work. She wants to take advantage of the fact that she is currently single and does not have children to grow her business and save money.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 36 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-aged children.

Joan has a sari-sari store business, and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan to purchase stock.

Joan has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Joan hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 32 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He is married with three school-aged  children. 

Rolando has business of motorcycle transportation; he earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. 

He has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle parts for motor repair.

Rolando has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. 

In the future, Rolando hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts for motor repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her customer base and purchase an Ozone Machine

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est  née en 1986, mère d’un enfant, elle est en location avec son mari à Lomé au Togo quartier Adidogomé ou elle a débuté son petit commere. Amivi est une revendeuse de riz et d’huile végétale depuis 2010 ce qui l’a permis de financer partiellement son apprentissage et de devenir coiffeuse en 2011. 
Accueillante, elle a su fidéliser ses clients et dans cette perspective elle sollicite un crédit pour renouveller son stock et mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
Actuellement pour palier aux problèmes de stock de riz et d'huile végétale, elle vend du maïs et des fruits notamment l'avocat.
texts.en:
Amivi was born in 1986, and she is the mother of one child. She rents a place together with her husband in Lomé, Togo, in the Adidogomé district where she established her little business. Amivi has been reselling rice and vegetable oil since 2010, which has allowed her to partially finance her apprenticeship and become a hairdresser in 2011. 

With her welcoming manner, she has managed to find repeat customers and from this perspective, she is requesting a loan to renew her stock and better satisfy the needs of her clientele. Presently, to compensate for her difficulty stocking rice and vegetable oil, she is selling maize and fruit, in particular avocados.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice and two jerrycans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Dúo Orquideas De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Orquideas de San Pedro. La señora María tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace tres años, ella es la encargada del grupo,  Está pidiendo un préstamo porque necesita comprar varias cosas como azúcar, frijol, arroz, pastas, jabón, aceite, que le hacen falta en el negocio.  Lo apoya en todo su esposo, y su sueño es tener una abarrotería y ofrecerles de todo a sus clientes para no perder la venta y tener la ganancia suficiente para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is in charge of the Dúo Orquideas de San Pedro [the Orchids of Saint Peter Duo]. She has had a small store in her home for three years now. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of items, such as sugar, beans, rice, pasta, soap, oil, as well as other items she needs in her business. Her husband supports her in everything. Her dream is to have a full-fledged grocery store to be able to sell everything to her customers and not lose any sales. She would like to make enough profit to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, pasta, soap, oil and other items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build her inventory and strengthen her marketing campaign

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio combined his vast experience of management and accounting with his personal passion for Jiu Jitsu to create Sugoi Submissions.

Dedicated to providing low cost, high quality kimonos, Sergio has established a large network of clients in both the U.S. and abroad and plans to use his connections from world Jiu Jitsu tournaments to build a large client base. 

Sergio hopes to increase his inventory, expand his marketing outreach, and afford legal costs associated with international business.

loans.use: to increase inventory, do marketing, and cover legal costs associated with international business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 45 years old and lives in Locsoon Tudela, Mis Occ. She is married with one, school-age child.
 
Elvie has a buy-and-sell business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan for rice field redemption.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to attain rice field redemption

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrés, es acompañado, es padre de dos hijos, desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar como ayudante en actividades de agricultura y ganadería, ya con el tiempo formo su hogar, es entonces cuando decide trabajar de forma independiente, cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, por el momento no ha tenido dificultades que represente algún riesgo para él y su familia.
Recurre a solicitar un préstamo para pagar la recolección de la cosecha, comprar insumos agrícolas y terneros, con lo que pretende mejorar su producción, aumentar el ganado que ya posee y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, para facilitar el pago de las cuotas y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Se anhela en trabajar muy duro para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y crecer cada vez más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Andres is married and has two children. He learned to work as a farmhand in agriculture and livestock when he was very young. With time he set up his own home and decided to work on his own. He now has 20 years of experience, and he has never had any difficulties that could have been a problem for him or his family.

He is requesting another loan to pay for labor to harvest his crops and to buy agricultural inputs and calves. He hopes to improve his production, increase the number of head of cattle he has, and improve the profitability of his business so he can make his loan payments and pay his household expenses.

His dream is to work very hard to improve the infrastructure of his home, improve his family’s living conditions and grow his business even more.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest his crops and to buy agricultural inputs and calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a vehicle and build credit.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny and Javier are a married couple who co-own Ja-Fann Corp., a construction and remodeling business based in central Florida. They work mostly with renovations and construction contracts on local rental units and condos, but also coordinate with a management company based in California. 

They have employed three additional employees and envision expanding with the rising housing market and continued partnership with California-based management companies.

They hope to continue to expand their business, purchase another van to increase productivity, and obtain a personal computer. In addition, Fanny and Javier want to build a stronger line of credit for future business expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase an additional van and computer and establish a line of credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computers and pay off start-up debt

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking mother who supports her husband in generating an income. She is 39 years old and has three school-aged children. Hardship and difficulties in life push her to strive harder to provide for her family's needs.

Rowena aims to improve her small business in order to generate a higher income. She plans to acquire a larger stock of hardware to sell, but she has limited capital. With her situation, she is asking for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of bulbs, mirrors, combs, nails, flashlights, scissors and screws to sell in the market. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of bulbs, mirrors, combs, nails, flashlights, scissors and screws to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer worked as a financial advisor for Goldman Sachs until one day, she turned her passion into a reality with the creation of Ombre Rouge Hair LLC. 

Utilizing a home-based enterprise focused on providing women with high quality hair extensions, Jennifer is dedicated to exceptional products with competitive prices.
 
With her vast experience of financial advising and her simple business model, Jennifer envisions working directly with local hair salons to efficiently distribute high quality weaves with 100% customer satisfaction.

She hopes to use her loan to build an efficient website, increase her marketing outreach, and create a large inventory to meet customer demands.

loans.use: Build website, increase marketing, and expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics, and household items

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is the sole owner and operator of a lucrative transportation service that shuttles clients around various destinations in Florida. 

Mario is dedicated to expedient service and exceptional prices. While he currently works alone, he is striving to expand his business in the future. 

Mario envisions owning and operating a fleet of buses to efficiently transport clients around the vivacious state of Florida. 

He hopes to purchase tools and equipment to maximize the efficiency of and maintain adequate repairs of his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to adequately keep his vehicle running well

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is an independent owner of the successful Pinetop Tennis & Swim Club. Since 2008, members have enjoyed luxurious facilities, a spacious swimming pool, large tennis courts, and professional lessons for both children and adults. 

Pinetop Tennis & Swim club represents a great business ready to become elite. With friendly staff, member-oriented facilities, and a low, long-term cost structure for new investments, William has positioned his business for success. 

William hopes to continue to expand Pinetop by adding four sand volleyball courts. These new amenities have a low maintenance cost and will not only act as a new source of revenue, but will also attract new members to the club.

loans.use: to construct four sand volleyball courts

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet owns and operates a legal office, Caribbean Consultant Inc., which aids clients with immigration forms, immigration interviews, divorces, guardianship disputes, and tax services. 

She has been in operation since 2005, but has been forced to move locations due to carbon monoxide issues in her current establishment. 

She hopes to use her loan to help cover large, one-time costs such as moving expenses and new signage fees.

loans.use: to pay for moving expenses and new signs

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una señora de 25 años, vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Diana vive en unión libre con su esposo Alberto, tienen dos hijitos un niño de 6 y otro de 3, su hijo mayor estudia en una escuela fiscal cerca a su domicilio, todos los días Diana va a recogerlo a la hora de salida.
Diana y su esposo hace cinco años emprendieron en el negocio de la venta de mariscos, ellos trabajan todos los días en el mercado, vendiendo en bandejas su producto principal que es el camarón. Todo este tiempo han trabajado muy duro por sus hijos para darles la educación y un hogar donde vivir, gracias a este esfuerzo han podido construir poco a poco su casa, la misma que aún no está terminada en su totalidad. Solicitan un pequeño crédito para la compra de camarón, para poder incrementar sus ventas y con estas ganancias poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
Diana agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva ya que por medio del crédito puede apoyar a su esposo y mejorar su desarrollo personal y económico.
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old and lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, which is a city in the coastal region with a warm and humid climate. The city is home to a lot of commerce, because it is where the sierra and the coast meet.

Diana is in a common-law marriage with her husband Alberto. They have two sons, ages six and three. Her oldest son goes to a public school near their home. Diana goes to pick him up everyday when school is finished.

Five years ago, Diana and her husband started a business selling seafood. Every day they work in the market, selling their principal product, which is shrimp. All this time they have worked very hard for their children to give them an education and a home in which to live. Thanks to this effort, they have been able to build their home, little by little, but it is not finished. They are requesting this loan to buy shrimp so they can increase their sales and profits and finish the construction of their home.

Diana is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva because, with this loan she can support her husband and improve her economic and personal development.

loans.use: to buy shrimp for her business.

loans.name: Willian Asael

texts.es:
Willian, es un hombre dedicado a buscar el bienestar de su familia, se esfuerza en generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, se dedica a realizar viajes en camión, transporta estudiantes en un microbús, ya tiene 20 años de experiencia, además hace 4 años instalo un molino nixtamal en su vivienda para tener ingresos extras. Vive junto  a su esposa, dos hijos y su madre.
El crédito lo invertirá en l compra de repuestos para el camión y el microbús, así mismo dará mantenimiento al molino, lo que le servirá para seguir dando un servicio seguro y de agrado para sus clientes, espera mejorar su economía para cancelar sin inconvenientes la deuda adquirida.
La aspiración de Willian es mantenerse trabajando para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y ofrecer a su familia un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Willian is a man who is devoted to looking out for his family’s well-being.  He puts forth great effort generating the income needed to cover the family expenses.  He makes trips by truck and he transports students in a minibus.  He has 20 years of experience.  Also, four years ago he installed a mill for grinding corn at his house.  He did this in order to have extra income.  He lives with his wife, two children, and his mother.

He will use the loan to buy replacement parts for the truck and the minibus.  He will also perform maintenance on the mill.  This will allow him to continue providing safe service that pleases his customers.  He hopes to improve his finances in order to repay the acquired debt without any difficulties.

Willian aspires to keep working in order to make improvements to his house and to provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for the truck and the minibus and to perform maintenance on the mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a website and advertising

loans.name: Shane

texts.en:
Shane and Daniel co-own and operate the small business Vindictive Vinyl LLC, which creates and installs vinyl for local businesses, vehicles, and computers. 

Their business develops and installs bold marketing techniques for a variety of platforms. Shane and Daniel have a highly trained team dedicated to fast installation and unrivaled customer satisfaction.
 
They hope to increase their inventory of vinyl, invest in an additional printer to maximize output and efficiency, and to expand their marketing outreach.

loans.use: to buy more vinyl and a printer and pay for additional marketing

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Kaday. She is married and has three children aged 6, 9, and 13. In 2010, Kaday established her provisions, drinks, and recharge cards business. She began her business just to be self-reliant and help the husband run the affairs of the home. Her business is located at the outskirts of town and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 756,680 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Kaday has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy provisions, drinks, and recharge cards. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level and raise more profit. In the future, Kaday plans to expand the business to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mayonnaise, butter, and milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dresses for her stall

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Zainab.  She is married and has two children ages 6 and 12 years old.  She has one additional dependent, who lives with her helping her with her schooling.  In 2002, Zainab established her cooking condiments business.  She began her business just to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. 

Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are adults.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 683,300 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.  Zainab requires a loan in order to buy onions, salt, magi and sugar.  She hopes that this loan will improve her stock level and raise more profits.  In the future, Zainab plans to expand the business to a shop.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cooking condiments for her shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es casado, tiene dos hijos, tiene casa propia en La Paz, él se dedica al comercio de llantas y articulos de mecanica, Mario es la unica fuente de sustento para su familia y debe pagar toda clase de gastos como educacion y salud de sus hijos. Mario necesita un credito para incrementar el numero de partes, piezas y accesorios de su negocio de repuestos para vehiculo. Mario desea a futuro construir un deposito mas grande para estar mas comodo y tener mejoras en sus ingresos
texts.en: Mario is married and has two children. He has his own home in La Paz. He has a business selling spare tires and car parts. He is the only source of support for his family, and pays all kinds of household expenses, from education to his children’s health. Mario is requesting this loan to buy parts, accessories and spare tires for his business. In the future, Mario would like to build a larger warehouse to secure his business and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy parts, accessories and spare tires for his business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 53 year old Abdul.  He is married and has four children ages 4, 7,18 and 26 years old.  He has one additional dependent, who lives with him helping him with the house chores.  In 2008, Abdul established his used bag business.  He began his business just to be self-reliant after coming from working the mines. 

His business is located in city centre and his main customers are adults.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 899,313 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.  Abdul requires a loan in order to buy school bags and traveling bags.  He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and expand the business.  In the future, Abdul plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more travelling bags

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
This is 40 year old Sia.  She is a widow and has three children ages 7, 15 and 21 years old.  She has one additional dependent, who lives with her just to help her with the house chores.  In 2008, Sia established her food and drinks business.  She began her business because she to be self-reliant after losing the husband. 

Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are both men and women . Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 892,800 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.  Sia has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and onions.  She hopes that this loan can improve the stock level and raise the profits.  In the future, Sia plans to expand the business to other areas of the town.  She thanks you for your support.
