loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients (e.g., rice, onions, and palm oil)

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mohamed M.  He is married and has 3 children ages 5, 4 and 2 years old; two are in school.  He has 3 additional dependents, who live with him to be fostered and to help in the business. 

In 2001, Mohamed M. established his nails, hammers, levels, spanners, lamp holders, bulbs, painting brush, extensions etc. business.  He began his business because he stopped in school in Grade 4 for lack of support for his education.  He used to assist his mother in her business and when he dropped out of school his mother gave him some amount of money to start a building materials business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.  Mohamed M. requires a loan in order to buy paint brushes, hand tissue, padlocks, plane, nails, extension cables, solvents, lamp holders, electric bulb and hammers.  Mohamed has succeeded in buying some land, he is planning to educate his children and younger ones; he was unable to open a shop because of the high rental cost of shops.  This loan will help to improve the business and generate more income.  Inadequate capital is his major challenge.  He is a hardworking and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, hand tissue, padlocks, plane, nails, extension cables, solvents, lamp holders, electric bulb and hammers.

loans.name: Maxwell M

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Maxwell who has established an office supplies business. He is maintaining his stationery business.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he now earns about Le 3,000,000 every month. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. He requires a loan to buy cartons of A4 paper, cartridges, office trays, paper files, and ledger books. 

Maxwell has succeeded partially as he is now a supplier and built a house but has not bought a car or opened different outlets. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy paper, cartridges, office trays, paper files, and ledger books.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Because she is a hardworking mother, Marilou helps her husband generate enough income to satisfy the needs of her family. She is 48 years old and has three children.

Marilou operates their motorcycle transport business while her husband cultivates their farmland. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, the couple both work hard to increase their income. Marilou is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Abdulai F.

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Abdulai F.   He is establishing his business of selling clothing and accessories such as jeans, crepes (sneakers), boots, traveling boxes (luggage), school bags, and shirts. 

He has paid off his previous loan.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month.  He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to purchase bales of traveling boxes, school bags, jeans, and shoes. 

Abdulai has bought and is now traveling to the neighboring country for his goods.  This loan will help him to generate more income.  He is a hardworking businessman who thanks you for providing financial support for his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of traveling boxes, school bags, jeans, and shoes.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has one child, age four years old. He has no additional dependents. 

In 2007, Ibrahim established his beer, stout, and other alcoholic beverages business. He began his business because he wanted to adequately take care of his needs and his home. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are neighbors and passersby. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,300,000 every month from this business.
 
Ibrahim would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 to buy more crates of beer and stout.  With the help of the last loan, he was able to increase his profit by Le 300,000. In the future, Ibrahim still plans to open another shop in one of the provinces. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and stout to sell.

loans.name: Sao Kha

texts.en:
Sao Kha is a married woman who is 30 years of age. She just finished her education at the primary school level due to the family’s economic constraints. She left school and began working in agriculture. Sao Kha is married to a local farmer and together they are blessed with three children who are currently being educated at school.

She grows rice and cassava, one after another, as this allows her to bring in money during the entire year. She started in this field about 14 years ago, learning from her parents whose agribusiness was passed on for generations. With great support from her spouse and children, Sao Kha is able to earn a daily income of KHR 21,000, which assures her of enough money to supply food and pay the home bills and the costs of other commodities.

With the aim of further developing her farming business, Sao Kha has requested a loan to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area. In this way, she will be able to increase her productivity through the year and augment her income for the household. She is very thankful for the loan support, which enables her to go far in her current business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to expand her farming areas.

loans.name: Sonia Sabina

texts.es:
Maria se dedica a brindar servicio de turismo pues tiene una agencia de viajes donde vende boletos de viaje a diferentes lugares como por ejemplo el Valle Sagrado de los Incas y al Santuario de Machupicchu, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y que desde hace varios años pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. 

Maria se siente contento por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria works offering tourist services.  She has a travel agency where she sells tickets for trips to different places, such as the Sacred Valley of the Incas and the Sanctuary of Machu Picchu.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is getting her family ahead.  For a number of years she has belonged to the “Cusco” communal bank.  At this point she needs a loan to buy tickets for tourists.

Maria is happy, thanks to the loan.  She is committed to being responsible and making her payments on time.  She thanks all the investors for the loan and hopes that they keep supporting other projects.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Consuelo, pertenece a una familia la cual está formada por su esposo y un hijo, como una forma de tener recursos económicos suficientes para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, hace ya 6 años que se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, así como también alimento y jaulas para mascotas, es apoyada por su esposo.
El capital que requiere lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de granos básicos, jaulas y alimento para mascotas, con esta ayuda su negocio se mantendrá ofreciendo buenos productos y lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.
Para Consuelo su sueño es  tener un negocio más amplio con más y mejores productos para que le de la rentabilidad necesaria para trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en: Consuelo belongs to a family comprised of her husband and one son as a way to have sufficient economic resources to cover living expenses. For six years, she has worked selling basic grains, as well as pet food and pet cages. Her husband supports her. She requires resources that she will use to invest in the purchase of basic grains, cages and pet food. With this help, her business can continue offering good products and all that is needed to satisfy her customers. For Consuelo, her dream is to have a widespread business with more and better products to give her the profitability needed to work with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cages, and pet food.

loans.name: 3.3.2.961.4.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Vân is 43 years old and is married with two children. She has no dependents since her children have grown up. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

Vân is the group leader of the 3.3.2.961.4.Thiệu Lý  solidarity group which consists of three members. In 2006, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Vân hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.9.962.8.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Vinh is 57 years old and is married with three children. She supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, since her children have grown up.

Vinh has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

She is the group leader of the 3.9.962.8.Thiệu Dương solidarity group which consists of six members. This is Vinh's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW). She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: 3.9.963.8.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Tình is 59 years old and is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents since her child has grown up.

Tình operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

She is the group leader of the 3.9.963.8.Thiệu Dương solidarity group which consists of four members. In 2011, Tình joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Tình has successfully repaid four loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW). She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Casandra Maria

texts.es: Casandra tiene 22 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera y desde temprana edad estudia y trabaja. Actualmente, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Casandra cuenta con muy pocos recursos económicos lo que la ha motivado siempre a salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, todos sus proyectos los ha realizados se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hoy en día. Solicita el crédito para pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título cumpliendo su sueño más deseado en la vida. Su plan futuro es poder aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Casandra, 22, is a native of the city of Leon.  She is a single youth who has studied and worked from a young age.  She is now studying in one of the universities in the city.  Casandra does not have a lot of financial resources, and this has motivated her to always put a lot of effort and dedication into getting ahead.  She feels proud of what she has achieved, because as of today, she has carried out all of her plans.  She is requesting a loan to finance the fees that she must pay to register her degree so that she can obtain her diploma, accomplishing her most important dream in life.  In the future, Casandra plans to apply the knowledge she has acquired so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to pay to register her degree so that she can get her diploma

loans.name: Solidaridad De Patachaj Group

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es soltero. De 24 años de edad. De escolaridad 5 años de educación primaria. Se dedica a la sastrería. Inició este negocio siendo operario con un vecino y a la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una maquina de coser. Desea en el futuro tener una maquila para generar fuentes de empleo en su comunidad y aumentar sus ganancias.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se deciana a la prestación de servicos y actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 24 years old, single, and completed five years of his primary school education. He is a tailor by trade. Francisco started his business with a neighbor and now he has seven years of experience.

He organized a group so that he could request a loan for buying a sewing machine. In the future, he wants to have a business that can create jobs in his community and will allow him to increase his earnings.

The other group members engage in service-related and agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat, a 34-year-old mother three children, is a local farmer who manages one hectare of farmland, growing cassava in Kampong Cham province, where her residential area is. She can earn extra income via working for others, for a fee. For ages, involvement in her current business has generated almost KHR 20,000 KHR per day. 

Now, Sarat is in need of working capital to support her crops, so she leads a group of three to get a new loan. She is in her third cycle, requesting KHR 1,400,000 and her remaining two borrowers are in their first cycle, applying for KHR 1,000,000 each, through VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner).  

Sarat has utilized her past two loans wisely to uplift her lifestyle, especially to provide decent food for her children. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, weeding fees, and to purchase insecticide. She hopes this purchase will support her cash crop on time, so that she can get a yield with high income in order to renovate her house to a better condition.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, weeding fees, and to purchase insecticide.

loans.name: Enrique Alexander

texts.es:
Enrique, es un joven soltero que vive junto a su mamá, él es proveedor principal de los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos familiares, por iniciativa propia y con ayuda de su mamá emprendió su negocio, el cual consiste en venta de papas y hot dog, lo hace en las ferias y otros eventos, por el momento es una actividad que no le representa dificultades.
Solicita capital para invertirlo en la reparación del coche de trabajo así como también en compra de pan, aderezos, gas propano, embutidos, papas, aceite, etc., lo que le ayudar a mejorar el servicio y calidad de sus productos.
Anhela tener un patrimonio digno para cuando llegue el momento de formar su familia y también continuar ayudando a su madre a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Enrique is a single young man who lives with his mother. He is the main provider and is responsible for bringing in the necessary income to cover his family’s expenses. Through his own initiative and with help from his mother, Enrique established his business of selling hot dogs and French fries. He sells his food at the fairs and at other events. At the moment, his business does not present any difficulties.

Enrique is requesting capital so that he can invest in repairs to the car he uses for work. He will also buy bread, seasonings, propane gas, cured meats, potatoes, oil, and other supplies. This will help him to improve his service and the quality of his products.

Enrique hopes to have decent assets built up for when he starts a family. He also wants to continue helping his mother move forward.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his work vehicle and to buy bread, seasonings, propane gas, cured meats, potatoes, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alicia Martina

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que vive en la ciudad del Cusco que está ubicado al sur del Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más útiles de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, lapiceros, fólderes y otras cosas más. 

Alicia que desde hace varios años pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco”  y le va  excelente. 

Alicia se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Alicia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Cusco, which is located in southern Peru. She sells writing supplies from her home. Alicia has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more writing supplies such as paper, pens, folders, and other items.

Alicia has been a member of the Communal Bank “Cusco” for several years and the group is doing an excellent job.

Alicia is pleased with the loan and promises to submit her payments punctually and handle them with great responsibility. She appreciates all of the lenders who participate in this loan and hopes that they will continue to support other projects.

loans.use: to buy paper, pens, folders, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria Soledad vive en la ciudad del cusco ubicado al sur de Perú. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de desayunos como por ejemplo quinua con leche, mates, maca y entre otros, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar quinua, tarros de leche, sacos de azúcar y maca.

Maria Soledad se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru.  She is an enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with effort and dedication to her work.  Her main business is selling breakfasts like quinoa with milk, teas, and ‘maca’ [Peruvian root vegetable], among others.  She has belonged to the “Cusco” communal bank for several years.

This time she needs the loan to buy quinoa, cans of milk, sacks of sugar, and maca.

Maria Soledad is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments punctually and very responsibly.  She is grateful to all of the lenders for the loan, and she hopes they continue helping with the other projects.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, cans of milk, sacks of sugar, and maca.

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en:
Dany is 33 years old and a local citizen from Kampong Cham province where cassava is a well-known product. To support her entire household, especially her only son who is in school, Dany does cassava farming on one hectare of farmland, rice farming on two and half hectares, and has a pig raising business. These are the businesses that she has been occupied with for 13 years. 

Dany, a fourth-time borrower requesting 1,400,000 KHR, formed a group with two first-time borrowers requesting 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Dany's past loans which she has repaid have enabled her to keep her kids in school and provide sufficient food and clothes for her kids. Now, she is the leader of her group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and to transplant her cassava. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a high price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to transplant her cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree and postgraduate expenses.

loans.name: Famy

texts.es:
La socia vive en la ciudad del cusco ubicado al sur del Perú. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la brindar servicio  de Hotel, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sabanas, colchas y frazadas.

La socia se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
The member lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru.  She is an enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with effort and dedication to her work.  Her main business activity is providing hotel services.  She has been a member of the “Cusco” communal bank for several years.

This time she needs the loan to buy sheets, bedspreads, and blankets.

The member is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments punctually and very responsibly.  She is grateful to all of the lenders for the loan, and she wishes for them to continue supporting the other projects.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads and blankets.

loans.name: 08-01-06-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liễu has had a service providing housing rentals for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment to support that service.

Liễu, a 50-year-old married mother of five, four of whom are grown, is the group leader of the 08-01-06-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has repaid her four previous loans. The main hardship that Liễu faces  is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liễu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to support her housing rental service.

loans.name: Moses Bai

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Moses Bai. He is single and has one child, age 6. In 2009, Moses Bai established his pharmacy business. He began his business as a way of becoming self-employed and to develop himself. His business is located in the outskirts of the city.  Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about LE 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of LE 5,000,000. Moses Bai requires a loan in order to buy more medicines for his pharmacy. He hopes that this loan will help him attract more customers and enable him to stock his pharmacy with quality medicines. In the future, Moses Bai plans to expand his business and provide a good education for his child.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: 08-02-03-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and meat to make soup to sell. 
Hoa is 51 years old and is married with three children, all adults.
Hoa is the group leader of the 08-02-03-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 
In 2012, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase rice and meat to make soup to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has no children.  In 2012, Aminata established her building materials and electrical appliances business. She began her business because she needed to support her husband to provide a livelihood for their family and to develop herself. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are adults.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about LE 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of LE 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more building materials and electrical appliances for resale. She hopes that this loan will help to expand her business.  In the future, Aminata plans to open another shop. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more building materials and electrical appliances for resale.

loans.name: 08-01-04-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells sweet rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and meat to resell.

Hạnh is 43 years old and married with two children -- one dependent while the other is an adult.

Hạnh is the group leader of the 08-01-04-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hạnh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid four loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well. She plans to build a new house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and meat to resell.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim is 35 years old and a mother of four children, one in school. She lives and grows crops in Kampong Cham province. This one hectare area of cassava farming plus her paid working job generates about 23,600 KHR. Kim is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to repay her past loans with success, enabling her to support her business as well as to provide sufficient meals for her children. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. Her joint member, a second-time borrower, is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Kim will spend her entire loan portion to pay the farmland leasing fee and to pay the plowing fee, insecticide purchasing fee, and weeding cost for her cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can provide food for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To pay farmland leasing fee and to pay plowing fee

loans.name: Dúo Rositas De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rositas de San Mateo
Este dúo está conformado por doña María Salome, ella tiene 56 de edad y se dedica a la venta de comida en su comunidad de San Mateo Milpas Altas, frente al parque de lunes a sábado, ella está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una cafetera, asi como un par de mesas y sillas, y la otra parte lo utilizada,  para la instalación de agua potable en su local, y necesita comprar tubos, pago de albañil, su deseo es seguir mejorando su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Rositas de San Mateo” (Little Roses of San Mateo) Group

This group includes Doña María Salome. She is 56 years old and sells food in the community of San Mateo Milpas Altas. Her business is located in front of a park and is open Monday through Saturday.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a coffee pot, as well as a pair of table and chairs. Part of the loan will be used to install a water line into her business, so she will need to buy pipes and pay a plumber. Her wish is to continue improving her business and to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a coffee pot, tables, chairs, and pay to have a water line installed at her business.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
After six months of raising pigs, Ni Nengah sold two of her pigs and made a profit of 300.000 IDR per month. These results have been deducted from loans of 1.500.000 IDR to MUK. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Ni Nengah was able to develop pig raising efforts so as to help the family income.

These results are certainly very useful for families and can help pay their children's school fees. Although the price of piglets as well as pig feed is currently expensive, Ni Nengah retains a passion for the business development of pigs with the group she leads.

After successfully repaying the previous loan, Ni Nengah and the Kerta Jaya Amerta group decided to continue the loan, and each gets 1.500.000 IDR. One member resigned from the group after she had enough profit from the sales. Now she has capital to run the business by herself. Ni Nengah is fully supported by her husband because her business is considered beneficial to the family economy.

Ni Nengah has two children. She plans to use this loan to buy superior piglets and her own capital to buy pig feed for six months. Ni Nengah is hoping to gain more profit than with the previous loan which only make a profit of 300.000 IDR per month.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Khosbayar

texts.en: Khosbayar, 34 years old, lives with his wife and mother in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He is a policeman who has been working for the police department since 2000. His wife has a position of auditor at a social insurance agency. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. The renovated house will enable his family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 33, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Jay, an electrician and she is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, Bella manages their household while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Bella maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and the item is given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog and the difference represents the profit that dealers are receiving. 

Bella's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products. 

Bella dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 40 years old and a widowed mother of four children. The main sources of her family income are from her grocery selling business and her paid working job. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of three to get their first loan. The total loan request of her entire group is 2,500,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items to replenish her business. She hopes that she can receive financial aid timely to support her business so that she can get a good income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to replenish her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Euladio

texts.en:
Euladio is married with 4 children. Euladio is 65 years old and lives in Salvador, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte. Euladio owns a general merchandise store to earn a living. He has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP for additional capital.

Euladio is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Euladio hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to restock his store with several items such as slippers, bags, clothes and other items to sell.

location.town: Liloy- Salvador, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Assanatu

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Assanatu. She is married and has 2 children aged 22 and 19 years. In 2012, Assanatu established her rice, cement, and building materials business. She began her business to help her husband support the home and family. Her business is located in outskirts of the city and her main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Assanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and get more profit so she can adequately take care of her needs. In the future, Assanatu plans to support her children’s education to university level and improve her business. 

Assanatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials for resale.

loans.name: Sunnah

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Sunnah. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 13. In 2005, Sunnah established her textiles business. She began her business just to be self-reliant and help her husband run the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 239, 0175 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Sunnah has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cotton and wax. She hopes that this loan will improve her stock and raise the profit. In the future, Sunnah plans to expand the business to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new textiles to offer for sale.

loans.name: Norma Judith

texts.es:
Norma tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, una hija en la universidad y la otra en bachillerato, nadie más depende de ella.

Actualmente es empleada de una alcaldía, pero ha decidido emprender un negocio de venta de ropa en su comunidad y pueblos vecinos, ya que necesita tener una fuente de ingreso para el hogar, ella planea realizar esta actividad los fines de semana. 

El crédito que Norma está solicitando, lo necesita para invertir en el negocio de venta de ropa que ha planeado, comprará  toda la mercedaria que pondrá a la venta, esto le va a generar mejores ingresos para su familia y además se sentirá satisfecha al trabajar en el comercio ya que es algo que a ella le gusta. 

Norma sueña con llegar a tener muchos clientes en el negocio de venta de ropa, tener mejor estabilidad económica para su familia y espera que el negocio de resultado, de esta forma les esta asegurando el estudio a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y no recibe ayuda de nadie.
texts.en:
Norma, age 39, studied through the seventh grade. She is a single mother and lives with her two children who are in school. One daughter is at the university and the other one is in high school. She has no other dependents.

Norma is currently employed by the city. However, she decided to start her own business of selling clothes in her community and in the neighboring towns. She needs another source of household income, so she plans to operate this business on the weekends.

The loan Norma is requesting will be invested in the clothing sales business that she plans to start. She will buy all of the merchandise that she can sell in order to generate more income for her family. In addition, she expects to gain satisfaction from retail work since it is something that she enjoys.

Norma dreams of gaining many customers for her clothing business. This will provide her family with better financial stability, so she is hopeful that this business will deliver results. Since she is a single mother, this would help her secure her children’s education because she does not receive assistance from anyone else.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her new business.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is 45 years old and a widowed mother of five children. Her main source of income is solely from her grocery selling business, which she has done since she was 20 years old.  Currently, it generates about 36,000 KHR per day. Savoeurn has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Savoeum will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items to replenish her business. She hopes that she can gain a good income from this business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to replenish her business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sokun is 40 years old and a mother of two dependent children, one who is a schoolchild and the other a little child. Rice farming and working for others for a fee are the main sources of her family’s income which has returned her about 22,700 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Sokun with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. This cycle, Sokun leads a group of five to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group’s representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a plot of farmland to expand her rice farming business. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow more paddies with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand her rice farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 08-01-03-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huệ has a service business, cleaning motorcycles. She is applying for a loan to purchase equipment to conduct a car-wash business. Huệ is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Huệ is the group leader of the 08-01-03-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has two dependents. In 2011, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Huệ hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to conduct a car-wash business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, is aged 32, is married and blessed with two children. She has been in the business of raising hogs for almost three years, and she earns a net income of PHP 6,000 for every hog she sells. Her net profits are usually spent on the school allowances of her children, and the rest goes for their daily expenditures. Due to inadequate funds, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed to cover the needs of her hogs. She is hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can earn more profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed to cover the needs of her hogs.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie is a 37-year-old mother blessed with five children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. As an additional source of income, Ronie engaged herself in the transportation business, in particular, motorcycle transport. She aims to keep her motorcycle in good condition so she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. She believes that her loan request will be granted to enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun is 37 years old and married with four children, two of whom are under school age. Noun and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for resale for almost twenty years to support their family daily living. 

Drought damaged their rice crops and as a result, affected their income. Noun is not new to VisionFund. After successfully repaying her fourth loan, she decided to ask for the fifth loan to spend on the rice paddy and also to buy more piglets for resale when they are big enough. 

Noun strongly hopes that this borrowed money will produce a good yield of crops, and that she can raise healthy pigs so that she can make more income from selling them. 

In the near future, Noun's family wishes to have sufficient working capital to expand her business to grow peppers.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for resale and to spend on her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is a resident of Kampong Cham province and a mother of four children. Her family has been farming rice and growing cassava for more than twenty years. The whole family relies solely on these businesses. This is her second loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Rat has spent her first loan wisely as the income earned improved the family living's condition. Rat is now leading a group of two members, including herself, to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. With her portion, she will buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation, hoping that the crops will produce a good yield, which in turn will make enough income to further improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
Vat, 69, lives in Ang village, which is in Cheung Pey, Kampong Cham province. He has three children who are married and live independent lives.

Vat has been a farmer for over thirty years. He and his wife manage a hectare and a half of farmland upon which they grow rice. He spends long hours every day taking care of his fields and the remaining time with his family. From his farm he is able to derive approximately 3.10 USD a day.

One of Vat’s children is a construction worker. He is having trouble at his job due to the lack of needed materials and tools. Being a responsible father and caring about his children, Vat is asking for a 1,000 USD loan to buy these for his son. This loan will be a huge support for Vat and his children.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and materials needed for his son’s business.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
6 months has passed and the Sarwa Wiguna group must repay their loans to MUK. During the period of the loan, they were able to keep pigs as well. Through the control and facilitation by the Loan Officer and Veterinarians, the pigs can grow well and healthy. Ideal weight is reached so that they can sell it satisfactorily. Ni Ketut sold 4 pigs for 4,000,000 IDR and after deducting expenses, she got a profit of 1,500,000 IDR. The sow gave birth to 10 healthy piglets, but they are not ready to sell yet. Although the profit was slightly reduced from the previous profit, she remains grateful and plans to continue this effort.

With same loan amount and the same members, the Sarwa Wiguna group continue their loan to MUK. This period, the loan will be used to purchase more superior piglets, feed and renovate the barn.

Ni Ketut already renovated her barn. Now the pigs cannot run away from her yard anymore; it’s keeping her house cleaner. Getting full support from her husband, Ni Ketut will use the loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. To manage the cost, she combines feed with a traditional feed. She hope she will have more success this time, more happiness and more profits. She also has dreams of fixing her house.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Rosario Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Las Vegas, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el menor de 13 años el cual estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella.
Doña Rosario es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así darles un mejor porvenir a sus hijos, ella tiene un bar, un restaurante y discoteca, solo atiende los fines de semana en el restaurante y discoteca y el bar si todos los días, los fines de semana son muchas la personas que llegan hasta el balneario a disfrutar de sus hermosas playas y es cuando más clientes tiene, actualmente por la cercanía de la temporada playera son mas y mas personas que están llegando al lugar buscando sitio para pasar unas esplendidas vacaciones razón por lo cual necesita del crédito para comprar lo necesario para brindar el mejor servicio y que esto le deje muy buenos ingresos por el bienestar suyo y de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, gaseosas y otras bebidas que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the credit group, Las Vegas, meet in Crucita Parish in the Canton of Portoviejo. This locality, called by the name “Crucita la Bella”, is known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited by domestic and foreign tourists. Señora Rosario, who is 57 years old, lives here.  She is a single mother with two children; one is grown, and the other is a minor, 13 years old, who attends high school and still lives with her. 

Doña Rosario is a very courageous woman who has always liked working in order to provide a better future for her children. She has a bar, and a restaurant with a discotheque; she works in the bar every day, and she works in the restaurant and discotheque only on the weekends, as that is when many people come to the resort to enjoy its beautiful beaches, and she has the most customers.

With the beach season approaching, more and more people are coming to the area, looking for a place to spend a glorious vacation; and this is why she needs a loan—to purchase what she needs in order to provide the best service.  This will allow her to have very good earnings for the well-being of her children and herself. 

This loan is for the purchase of supplies, soda pop, and other beverages that she sells. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it for the help that the loans provide. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, soda pop, and other beverages.

loans.name: Luis Artemidoro

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Las Vegas, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive don Luis, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad, la menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio. Su mujer es comerciante. 
Don Luis es un hombre que toda la vida le ha gustado trabajar y con el fruto de su esfuerzo honrado sacar adelante a su familia, el se tiene una pequeña tercena en el mercado, allí los fines de semana vende todo tipo de carnes, solo trabaja en estos días en este lugar porque es cuando más personas llegan a surtirse de víveres, pero en su casa el también vende la carne a los clientes que deseen , en el mercado también su esposa vende frutas y legumbres, es por eso que sus ventas son muy buenas ya que los clientes compran las legumbres y la carne a la vez, tiene mas de 15 años con este negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar carne para la venta. Lleva 2 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The members of the "Las Vegas" communal bank meet every fortnight in Crucita Parish of Portoviejo Canton. This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely spot and it is visited a lot by both nationals and foreigners. It is known as "Beautiful Crucita"

Luis lives here. He is 47 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which he has 4 children. Three of them are adults and the last is 14 years old and studies in Secondary School. His wife is a business person. Luis is a person who has enjoyed working all his life and with the fruits of his effort has gotten his family ahead. 

He has a small store in the market where he sells all kinds of meats on the week-ends. He only works these days in this place as that is when most people come to buy their food. But he also sells meat in his house to clients who want it. His wife sells fruits and vegetables in the market. So their sales are good as people come to buy vegetables and meat at the same time. He has been doing this for 15 years and it has allowed him to raise his family. The loan is to buy meat to resell. He has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and he likes it as the loans finance his business. His dream is to have a good store.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Rosa Laurentina

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Las Vegas, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene nueve hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa, uno de ellos con capacidades especiales el cual requiere de muchos cuidados. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus faenas de pesca, el en compañía de sus hijos se embarcan en una pequeña embarcación que tienen para realizar sus faenas de pesca, salen en la madrugada y en ciertas ocasiones desde el día anterior para así lograr una buena pesca, ellos pescan camarón y pescado en cualquier variedad, una vez que regresan a la playa ellos venden sus productos a comerciantes o personas que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar los mariscos. Actualmente está muy peligroso el trabajo ya que hay muchos aguajes y con esto ellos no pueden salir con mucha frecuencia pero aunque peligroso esta es la única forma que tiene para ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, combustible y alimentos. Lleva 2 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños es que siempre regresen con bien de sus faenas en el mar.
texts.en:
The members of the credit group Las Vegas meet In the village of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo. This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and which are visited by many tourists from Ecuador and from other countries. It is known by the name "Crucita la Bella" (Crucita the Beautiful). 

This is where Rosa lives. She is 59 years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which she has nine grown children, three of whom still live in her house. One has special needs and requires a great deal of care. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Rosa is a very good wife and is asking for this loan so that her husband can use the money for his tasks as a fisherman. He and his children go out on a small fishing boat they have. They leave at dawn and on some occasions they leave the day before so they can have a good catch. They fish for shrimp and all kinds of fish. When they return to shore they sell their catch to distributors or to individuals who come to buy the fish directly. Currently their work is very dangerous because there are many sudden, intense storms and this prevents them from going out frequently. Although it is dangerous, this is the only way he has to earn a living.

This loan is to buy nets, fuel, and food. She has been with the credit group for two years and likes it because the loans help them get ahead. Her dream is that they always come back successfully from their task at sea.

loans.use: to buy nets, fuel and food.

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en:
Ernelyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise for her direct-selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income is covers their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells frozen foods and offers rooms for rent for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The money from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ernelyn dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna  vive en la ciudad del cusco ubicado al sur de Perú. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio  de turismo, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos de viajes. 

Reyna se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the city of Cusco located in southern Peru. She is an enterprising woman who gets her family ahead with her efforts and dedication to her work. Her main economic activity is providing tourist services. She has belonged to the communal bank “Cusco” for several years and at this time is requesting a loan to purchase tourist tickets. 

Reyna is happy for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time and with great responsibly. She thanks all the lenders for the loan and wants them to continue supporting other projects.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets.

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
The group paid off all the loan on time. They sold the pigs with a good price. Now, the price for pork is about 25,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) per kilogram. Ni Made, the head of the group, maintained four superior pigs and all sold. She gained profit of 2,000,000 IDR for all. She’s really grateful for that. She has a plan to use the profit to enlarge her kiosk and save. During the last period of loan, she did not have a problem. All the pigs grew well. She says thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

Tegal Badeng Indah group has nine members and a total loan of 13,500,000 IDR. Having been successful with maintaining pigs for fattening, Ni Made will use this period of the loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pig barbeque. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her kiosk. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about the business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair the home and save for the future of her family. 

One member resigned and was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: To purchase four local piglets and merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Ngoné's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée depuis le premier cycle du banc villageois à la date du 26/12/2011. Il regroupe des femmes issus du même village unies par de bonnes relation sociales et professionnelles. Madame Diodio la responsable est une femme mariée âgée de 40 et mère de sept enfants dont trois garçons et quatre filles tous scolarisés.Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de poissons frais qu'elle au bord de la mère qu'elle revends au détails au niveau du village dans une bassine.Son crédit de trois cent mille 300000 lui a permis de se payer des paniers de poissons pour continuer son activité de commerce. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group has been in existence since the launch of the first banc villageois cycle on December 26, 2011. The group is composed of women living in the same village and maintaining good social and professional relations. Mrs. Diodio, the group's leader, is 40 years old, married and the mother of seven children: three boys and four girls. All children are in school. Mrs. Diodio sells fresh fish she [buys] at the coast and then resells at the village, keeping it in a water tank. Her loan of 300,000 West African francs has allowed her to buy baskets of fish in order to continue with her vending business. The resulting revenues  enable her to provide for her children's food and school fees as well as bolster her savings with the bank villageois.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a mother of three who is from Ou Reang Ov district, Kampong Cham province. She is 57 years old. She has been involved in a rice-farming business for more than 30 years, and this is the only business her family relies on. 

This is the third loan that Chantha received from VisionFund Cambodia. The previous two loans enabled Chantha to get necessary home appliances for the family. This third loan allows Chantha to get a decent motorbike for the family to conveniently get to the rice field.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's Solar Lighting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy threads in a variety of colours

loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Erlinda Aurora tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de La Florida San Miguel, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca que pertenece a la sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica junto a su hijo a la preparación y venta de comida, cuenta con un restaurant típico-rural-campestre, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, Erlinda ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera poder variedad de platos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erlinda Aurora is 51 years old. She lives with her son in the district of La Florida San Miguel, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the north of Peru. It is very green and its population makes a living from agriculture, trade, and ranching.

Erlinda and her son make a living by preparing and selling food. She has a traditional country restaurant and she has more than twenty years of experience in the business. Erlinda has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to purchase food-preparation supplies, such as sacks of rice, oil, and sugar, so she can offer a variety of dishes to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase food-preparation supplies

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
This is Hoeun. She is a 49-year-old farmer living in a rural village in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She previously used a loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the labor cost of plowing her paddy fields. The loan was a huge support for her and gave positive impacts to her business and general living conditions.

Hoeun is a widowed mother of a married child. She deals in rice and cassava farming to earn a living to take care of her family. 

She has applied for a loan to rent a 3-hectare farmland for growing cassava crops this coming season. She hopes to increase her production this year, augment her income and continue developing her living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a 3-hectare farmland for growing cassava crops this coming season.

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es:
Ella es cindy paola, vive con la hermana y con la mama, actualmente se encuentra estudiando y realizando un técnico en contabilidad financiera, toda la vida ha vivido con la mama y ella es la persona que se ha hecho cargo de ella desde que nació y le ha dado todo lo que ha necesitado hasta el momento, ella es una mujer  independiente y trabaja en una peluquería, bueno la verdad es que los ingresos no son muy altos como para seguir cancelando un gasto tan alto como lo es la cuota del estudio de cindy, a si que por eso le interesa el convenio que kiva le pueda ofrecer, como una mujer ya mayor de edad lo que esta tratando de lograr es conseguir un trabajo para así ayudarle a la madre cabeza de hogar, soltera  madre de dos hijas, la cual le causan varios gastos, con esto cindy la apoyaría pagando los estudios y le colaboraría con algunos de los gastos.
Hace dos años hizo parte de un programa que ofrecía técnicos por competencia 
en el campo laboral, se inscribió y paso, gracias  a este programa logro aumentar los conocimientos en todo lo que tiene que ver con una carrera como lo es contaduría publica y desde hace ya un año ingreso a la corporación a ampliar los conocimientos en la cual se  ha  sentido muy a gusto ya que le brinda una calidad de aprendizaje muy buena y se acomoda a ella como persona, ahora que tiene la Oportunidad de hacer algo para el bienestar no piensa en abandonar y así poder darle una ayuda a la mama. 
Se inclina hacia los deportes, le gusta hacer ejercicio, le gusta leer, y colaborar en la casa, también le gusta  participar en  obras teatrales o estar involucrada con todo lo que tenga que ver con cultura y las artes en general, ya que le gustaría hacer parte de una academia y estudiar artes escénicas, quiere  en un futuro  poder realizarce como una gran actriz y una contadora profesional,  reconocida como una mujer emprendedora y con una gran intensidad de colaborar con los mas necesitados del  país y poder hacer fundaciones no solo ella si no también con la colaboración de muchas personas que quieran apoyar al futuro del país.
texts.en:
Cindy Paola lives with her sister and her mother, and she is becoming a specialist in financial accounting. All her life she has lived with her mother, who has taken care of her since she was born, and has given her everything that she has needed up to now.  She is an independent woman who works in a hair salon, but the truth is that her income is not very high— and it is not enough to continue paying an expense as high as Cindy’s tuition payments.
 
This is why Cindy is interested in the agreement that Kiva can offer. Now that she is an adult, she is trying to get a job and thus help her mother, who is head of the household and a single parent who supports her two daughters. With this, Cindy would help her to pay for her tuition and for some of the expenses.

Two years ago she registered in a program that provided professional training, which she passed; and thanks to it, she was able to increase her knowledge of everything that relates to the field of public accounting. She has been attending the institution for a year in order to increase her knowledge; and she likes it very much, as it provides her with excellent quality training and helps her personally. Now that she has the opportunity to do something for her well-being she will not think of quitting--and thus she will be able to help her mother.

She likes sports, exercising, reading, and helping at home. She also likes participating in theatrical productions and being involved with everything that has to do with culture and the arts in general. She would like to enroll in an academy and study dramatic arts. In the future she wants to become a great actress and a professional accountant, and be known as an enterprising woman with a great passion for helping those who are most in need in the country.  She wants to be able to establish foundations, along with many other people who want to contribute to the future of the country

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de Perfumería, desde hace 3 años.
Doña Erika tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos los cuales recorre ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como lociones, perfumes, cremas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Erika las ganancias que le genera su negocio le es de mucha ayuda en el hogar. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario.
Doña Erika espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
Sra. Erika is a hardworking and responsible individual. She lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Erika has been selling perfumes for three years. Her business is in her house, which is located in the town where she lives. She also travels to places nearby to offer her products.

Doña Erika needs a loan so that she can buy more products such as lotions, perfumes, crèmes, and other items so that she can continue her work. The revenue she generates from her business is a great help to her household. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales since she does not have the necessary products to fulfill her customers’ orders each day.

Doña Erika expects to improve her family’s quality of life with the boost in her household income. In the short term, she wants to grow her business so that she can continue supporting her family. She also wants to provide her children with the necessary education so that they will have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, crèmes, and other products.

loans.name: Dúo Luceros De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCEROS DE LA MAÑANA
La señora Estefana de 65 años de edad,se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años es muy responsable en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para comprar semillas y fertilizante para seguir cultivando ya que la meta de ella a corto plazo es mejorar la calidad de su producto para tener mejores ganacias, esperando que le puedan ayudarya que en los creditos anteriores sus pagos no calleron en mora.
texts.en:
“Luceros de La Mañana” (Bright Stars of the Morning) Group

Sra. Estefana, age 65, has been farming for several years and is very responsible. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers so that she can continue farming. Her short-term goal is to improve the quality of her products so that she can generate more income.

She hopes that her group receives assistance since they were never behind in the payment of their previous loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth, 38 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She has been managing a direct selling business in their village for almost eight years. She is earning a net income of PHP 4,000 a month. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children and the other income is for food expenses. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 28,000 to purchase personal use products such as lingerie, makeup, lotions, and colognes to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase personal use products such as lingerie, makeup, lotions, and colognes to sell.

loans.name: Kutfiddin

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере Кутфиддина  занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Кутфиддин более 10  лет занимается земледелием. Ему 51 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Он в основном выращивает картошку, морковь, пшеницу. Он с удовольствием работает на поле с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Он ценит каждую частичку своей земли, так как это является основным кормильцем его семьи. Он планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
In Tajikistan, the land is the primary resource and the main basis for business.  Many people, like Kutfiddin, work in agriculture to earn a living. For over ten years, Kutfiddin has worked in farming.  He is 51 years old, married, and is raising five children, all of whom are still minors.  Kutfiddin primarily grows potatoes, carrots, and wheat.  From early morning to late at night he works the land with pleasure knowing that it is his family's benefactor.

Kutfiddin is planning to develop his business, but he doesn't have money for the purchase of seed and mineral fertilizer.  He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to buy seed and fertilizer.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: yo buy seed and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangos, papayas, oranges, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru:
Мадина незамужняя молодая девушка в возрасте 28 лет. У нее собственный бизнес. Она живет в городе Вахдат с матерью и сестрой. Отец и брат уехали на заработки в Россию. Мадина имеет свадебный салон. В течение 7 лет она занимается продажей и арендой свадебных платьев. Ей нравится помогать невесткам с выбором платьев. Она всецело отдается работе. 
Сейчас в семье Мадины беда. Ее мать серьезно больна и необходимо срочно собрать деньги на лечение. Единственный выход она видит в получении кредита. Так как эти лекарства дорогие, большая часть суммы денег уйдет на лекарство и медикаментов. На остальную сумму Мадина хочет провести ремонт в одной комнате дома. Зима в их городе очень холодная и к тому же всегда проблемы с электричеством. Поэтому Мадина к выходу матери с больницы хочет подготовить для нее отдельную комнату со всеми удобствами.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Madina is a young, unmarried woman.  She lives with her mother and sister in the city of Vahdat.  Her father and brother moved to Russia for work.  Madina owns her own business, a wedding salon.  For the last seven years she has been in the business of selling and renting wedding dresses.  She likes helping brides to chose their dresses.  She has given herself over entirely to her work.

Now there is a great misfortune in Madina's family.  Her mother is seriously ill and Madina needs to collect money for her treatment immediately.  The only choice she has is to take out a loan.  Since the medicines are expensive, the largest part of the loan will be for medicines and treatments.  Madina wants to use the rest of the money to repair one room in their house.  In their city, winters are very cold and there are also always problems with the electricity.  Madina wants to fix this room up with all the amenities for her mother before she is released from the hospital.

loans.use: to provide medical treatment for her mother, and in part to repair one room of her house

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Alberto es originario de la ciudad de León, casado y padre de 2 niños menores de edad. Tiene 20 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al alquiler de nintendo. Inicio su negocio hace 2 años y poco a poco ha ido creciendo significativamente. Solicita el crédito para la compra de 1 aparato moderno llamado Genkio. Estima que el crédito le será de gran utilidad ya que podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones del local donde actualmente tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberto is originally from the city of León. He is married and the father of two young children. Alberto is 20 years old and is a merchant who also rents out Nintendo games.

He started his business two years ago and over time it has grown significantly. Alberto is requesting a loan so that he can buy a modern video console that plays Genki games. He expects the loan to be of great use since he will be able to provide better service to his customers.

His future plan is to improve the conditions of the shop where his business is currently located.

loans.use: to buy a modern video game console.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru:
Жамила добрая трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 55 лет. Она родилась в селе Спитаменского района и до сегодняшнего дня проживает там. Жамила мать двоих детей. Дети уже взрослые, самостоятельно зарабатывают деньги. Сын Жамилы работает на фирме, производит и устанавливает окна  двери. Сама Жамила профессиональная швея. Она шьет постельное белье по заказу, а также шьет национальные платья сельским женщинам. Местные жители очень довольны Жамилой. 

Недавно Жамила начала производить национальные матрасы, а точнее она шьет основу матраса также  вышивает платки. В селе большой спрос на национальные матрасы (Курпачи) и платки, ведь не одно преданное невесты не обходится без красивых нарядно-ярких платков. Её деятельность налаживается хорошо,клиенты потихоньку умножаются. Жамила хотела бы увеличить товарооборот, но ей не хватает денежных средств для покупки тканей. Поэтому Жамила обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Жамила очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны организации, и заранее выражает свою  благодарность МДО "Арванд"
texts.en:
Jamila is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is 55 years old.  She was born in a village in the Spitamen Region and lives there to this day.  She is the mother of two children.  The children are both adults now and earn their own money.  Jamila's son works in a firm that makes and installs windows and doors.  Jamila is a professional seamstress.  She makes custom bedsheets as well as sewing traditional dresses for women who live in her and other villages.  They are all satisfied with her work.

Not long ago, Jamila began to make traditional mattresses.  More precisely she sews the basic mattress and she also embroiders shawls.  In her village there is a strong demand for traditional mattresses called a "Kurpach" and traditional shawls.  After all, a devoted bride can't do without beautiful, elegant and bright shawls.  

Jamila's business in going well and she is slowly but surely gaining new clients.  Jamila would like to increase her inventory but she doesn't have the financial resources to buy fabric.  For this reason, Jamila applied to MDO Arvand for a loan.  Jamila is relying on MDO Arvand's financial support and would like to express her gratitude to that organization.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for mattresses

loans.name: Álvaro Wilfredo

texts.es:
Álvaro es un joven de 24 años de edad,  que por la situación económica solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, a raíz de esa situación tuvo que  buscar un trabajo. Él está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a hacer pupusas todos los días,  con lo que aporta también ingresos al hogar, tienen un hijo de cuatro años que aún no asiste a la escuela, con el joven viven sus papás quienes también tienen negocio de pupusas.  

Álvaro se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés, trabaja para una panadería que le da el 30% de lo que él vende, ya tiene cuatro años de realizar esta actividad.
Este joven decidió realizar este trabajo debido a que no pudo continuar los estudios y por la necesidad de obtener ingresos económicos para mantener a su núcleo familiar, es la única actividad a la cual se dedica.
Para realizar su trabajo de venta de pan, debe hacer un recorrido diario de aproximadamente 20 kilómetros, ya que vende por todos los caseríos aledaños y el recorrido lo hace en su motocicleta, él se levanta desde muy temprano para prepararse y trabajar de 5:00 AM a 8:00 AM, y   por la tarde de 2:00 PM a 6:00 PM.
