Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo, para el pago de una deuda que adquirió cuando compró la motocicleta, de esta forma se le estará ayudando a poder salir más rápido del compromiso, pues se le han aumentado los intereses y nunca logra pagar la deuda. 

Sus propósitos a futuro son, aumentar la venta de pan, y tener más clientela, pues quiere estar preparado económicamente para cuando  su primer hijo comience la escuela. Y además las ganancias de su trabajo serán dirigidas para el  pago de la cuota y lo demás para la  inversión  a la casa y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a young man who is 24 years of age. Due to his financial situation, he was only able to complete a sixth grade education. As a result of his circumstances, he was forced to look for work. Álvaro is in a relationship and his partner prepares “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings) in order to contribute to the household income. They have four-year-old son who is not yet in school. Álvaro lives with his parents who are also in the business of selling “pupusas”.

Álvaro sells sweet bread and French bread. He works for a bakery that pays him a 30% commission from what he sells. Álvaro has been in this line of work for four years. This young man decided to pursue this job since he was not able to continue his studies and needed to generate income for his immediate family. This is his only means of employment.

In order to sell bread, Álvaro must travel approximately 20 kilometers each day. He sells in all of the neighboring villages and must travel on his motorcycle. Álvaro wakes up extremely early in order to get ready for work. His schedule is from 5:00 A.M. to 8:00 A.M. in the mornings and 2:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M. in the afternoons.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to repay the debt he acquired when he purchased his motorcycle. This will help him to quickly get out this commitment since rising interest rates have kept him from paying off this debt.

His future goals are to increase his bread sales and attract more customers. Álvaro wants to be financially prepared for when his son begins school. In addition, the earnings from his work will be directed toward the payments of this loan. He also wants to invest in a house and in his savings.

loans.use: to repay a debt he acquired when he purchased his motorcycle.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 39, married and blessed with four children. At present, she manages her business well. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in a hog-raising business for almost one year. In order to develop her business further, Thelma requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She plans to save more money because she wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo de crédito Más que Vencedoras desde hace 3 años, viven en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que goza de una estructura inclinada por su geografía,  su gente es amable, gentil y luchadora, lo más enigmático es su iglesia que se encuentra en lo más alto de la ciudad.
La Señora. María tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos es casado y vive independiente, sus dos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios de manera privada, la casa en la que vive es propia. 
Doña María pasa en casa al cuidado de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos, los mismos que los vende en pie. Su nuevo crédito es para construir de un nuevo galpón de pollos y así agrandar el negocio. Su meta es de viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Maria has been part of the 'Mas Que Vencedoras' [More Than Victorious] communal bank for three years, they live in the city of Azogues, a city which enjoys a structure inclined by its geography, its people who are kind, gentle and fighters. Its most enigmatic feature is the church, which is located at the highest point of the city.

Maria is 47 years old, married and this union has produced three adult children, one of them is married and lives independently, her two children work and help her economically, her husband is a chauffeur and renders his services privately, the house they live in is their own.

Maria spends her time looking after the home, but to support the family economically she raises chickens, which she sells on foot. Her new loan is to build a new chicken barn and expand the business. Her goal is to travel to the US.

loans.use: to construct a chicken barn.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Due to financial hardships, Jovelyn engages in direct selling of MSE, Avon, and Personal Collection, which she sells in her village. She is 38 years old and has two school-aged children. 

Jovelyn aims to make her business profitable to be able to support the education of her children. She plans to acquire more stock of the said products but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more stock of MSE, Avon, and Personal Collection to sell. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of MSE, Avon, and Personal Collection to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana desde hace 2 años forma parte del grupo de crédito Más que Vencedoras, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que goza de una estructura inclinada por su geografía,  su gente es amable, gentil y luchadora, lo más enigmático es su iglesia que se encuentra en lo más alto de la ciudad.
La Señora Ana tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de huevos de codorniz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Ana Ana labora con su esposo en la venta ambulante de huevos de codorniz, se encentran en este negocio desde hace 3 años y trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo. Su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de huevitos de codorniz. Su sueño es de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana has been part of the communal bank “Más que Vencedoras” for the last two years. She lives in the city of Azogues, a city that has inclined structures due to its geography. It is a city with kind and hardworking people, and it’s recognized for its church located at the top of the city. 

Ana is 27 years old, married, and as a result of this union she now has two children of 7 and 2 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying in a school in the city, and her husband is a street vendor who sells quail eggs. They don’t have a house of their own so they live in a rented property. 

Doña Ana works with her husband selling quail eggs. They have been working in this business for 3 years now, and they work every day without a fixed schedule. The loan will be invested in the purchase of quail eggs. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy quail eggs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 63 years old and widowed. She lives with one of her children in a rural community. Aside from farming, she also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Due to financial difficulties, she would like to raise more pigs to sell. Having limited capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has a strong determination to improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Ruhorwe Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe Ruhorwe  et habite à Cibitoke. Il est marié à Cécile, une cultivatrice. Il a  3 enfants âgés de 5 à 8 ans, tous  étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique (huile de palme, haricot, sucre, les unités téléphoniques,…)   depuis 7 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (huile de palme, haricot, sucre, les unités téléphoniques,…)   à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait  acheter un moulin, une moto, un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the Ruhorwe Group, and lives in Cibitoke.  He is married to Cécile, a farmer.  He has three children, aged between five and eight years old, all of his children currently attend school.

Jacques has been selling various products from his shop for seven years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use the money from his loan to increase his working capital, and buy many items for his shop (palm oil, beans, sugar, telephone credit units, etc).  He will then sell these products in order to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Jacques would like to buy a mill, a motorbike, some land for growing crops and to see his children continue to study.

loans.use: to buy many items for sale in his shop, such as palm oil, beans, sugar and  telephone credit units.

loans.name: Ngouye

texts.fr:
Madame Ngouye, âgée de 75 ans, est une maman qui malgré son âge, s’active toujours dans le commerce où elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 30 ans. Etant plus jeune, elle allait elle-même chercher la marchandise. Maintenant qu’elle a pris de l’âge, elle préfère continuer son activité à domicile. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300000F C FA, pour acheter du pain de singe et de la pâte d’arachide et revendre. Elle possède une clientèle fidèle qui la connait à travers la qualité de ce qu’elle vend. Avec ses bénéfices, elle appuie dans les dépenses de la maison et dans l’argent de poche de ses petits enfants.
 Actuellement, elle ne se soucis que du bien être de sa famille ;  désormais tout ce qu’elle fait c’est pour l’avenir de ces petits enfants.
texts.en:
Ngouye is seventy-five years old and has children.  Despite her age, she is still working, and she has more than thirty years' experience in her business.  When she was younger, she collected her merchandise herself, but now, with age, she prefers to work from her home.

Ngouye has requested a loan of 300,000 francs CFA. in order to buy baobab fruit and peanut paste for resale.  She has a loyal customer base, built up as a result of the high quality of the products that she sells.

With her earnings, Ngouye will provide for the expenses of her household and the pocket money of her grandchildren.  Nowadays, Ngouye only has one concern, and that is the well-being of her family, and especially the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit and peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  poissons frais à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 78 kg de poissons frais avec les pêcheurs  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of four married women who are, on average thirty-eight years old, and have three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni.  They know one another through friendship, business and neighbourhood ties.

In order to improve their businesses, by increasing their working capital, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth loan, all the previous loans were correctly repaid.

The women of the group sell fresh fish.  Awa (standing on the left in the photo) will use her loan to buy 78 kgs of fresh fish from the fishermen of Bougouni.  She sells her fish at the market and from her home, for cash or on credit, to a range of customers.  

Awa expects to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Cheikhou Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikhou Oumar, âgé de 36 ans est un boucher de profession, qui gère une boucherie dans le marché du quartier depuis maintenant 3 ans. Il possède une clientèle très fidèle. Sur un bœuf acheté à 290000F CFA, de 150 kilogrammes vendu, il peut obtenir un bénéfice de 40000F CFA. Et il faut noter que vu sa clientèle, il peut vendre un bœuf et demi voire deux, dans la journée. Cheikhou Oumar est marié et père de 3 enfants. Grâce à son activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Son souhait le plus cher serait d’agrandir sa surface commerciale et de varier ses produits tel vendre aussi du poulet de chair et du mouton.
texts.en:
Cheikhou Oumar is thirty-six years old, and a butcher, by profession.  He has been running his own butcher's stall at the local market for three years, and has a very loyal group of customers.

A beef cow, bought for 290,000 francs CFA, will yield 150 kgs of meat for sale, this will earn a profit of 40,000 francs CFA.  Given the number of customers he has, Cheikhou Oumar can sell one-and-a-half to two beef cows a day.

Cheikhou Oumar is married and has three children.  Thanks to the success of his business, he is able to provide for the day-to-day needs of his family.

In the future, he would really like to expand the physical size of his market stall, and extend the range of meat he offers, to include chicken and mutton.

loans.use: to buy beef cows for resale in his butcher's shop.

loans.name: Julieth Katherine

texts.es:
Julieth katherine es una muchacha que quiere salir adelante, ella desea  ser una gran profesora de preescolar, ella escogió esta carrera por que  le apasionan los niños, quiere saber cómo son ellos, que piensa y  le gusta interactuar con ellos.
Ha tenido varias experiencias de vivir con niños, conocerlos y convivir con ellos, cada vez que esta con los niños se divierte estando con ellos, le gusta convivir con los niños demasiado, aparte de eso le encanta jugar con ellos, es por eso que escogió esta carrera. 
Esta muchacha se apasiona  día a día por lo que quiere ser, por eso escogió el  instituto campo alto para poder empezar la carrera como profesora, ya que de allí le  han dado muy buenas referencias para   ser  profesora, a demás campo alto cuenta con una gran ayuda para los estudiantes la cual es kiva, a ella le llamo mucho la atención esta ayuda ya que los padres son los encargados de pagar la educación de ella y los gastos en el estudio son un poco costosos, con la ayuda del beneficio de kiva a ella le quedaría el valor de las cuotas un poco más económico.
texts.en: Julieth Katherine is a young woman who wants to get ahead. She wants to be an excellent Preschool teacher. She choose this work because of her passion for children. She wants to know what they are like and what they think, and she enjoys interacting with them. She has had various experiences living with children, getting to know them and each time she is with children she has fun with them. She likes to live with children a lot. Besides this she loves to play with them. That is why she choose this career as a teacher as she has good references to be a teacher. Also Campo Alto has great assistance for the students which is Kiva. This help has attracted her attention a lot as her parents are in charge of paying for her studies and it is a little expensive. With the help of a loan from Kiva the amount of the payments is more economical.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Mame Cheikh Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mame Cheikh, est un jeune de 31 ans qui débute dans le transport de moto-djakarta. Il est marié et loge à quelques kilomètres du guichet d’IMCEC de cette zone. Il vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit de 200000F CFA pour l’achat de cet engin. Il espère gagner en minimum une somme de 3000 à 4000F par jour ; recette avec laquelle, il pourra participer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille car il vit encore avec ses parents dans la maison familiale.
Comme, c’est un début, il a comme ambition de détenir au moins quatre à cinq motos qu’il va remettre à des jeunes comme lui pour les appuyer mais aussi pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Mame Cheikh is a young man, thirty-one years old, who would like to start a motorbike transport service.  He is married and lives several kilometres from the office of the field partner, UIMCEC.  He has requested this loan, his first, of 200,000 francs CFA, in order to buy a Djakarta motorbike.

He hopes to earn a minimum of 3,000 to 4,000 francs CFA a day with his transport business.  Mama Cheikh will use his earnings to help provide for the day-to-day expenses of his family, as he still lives with his parents in the family home.

As this is the start of a new business venture, Mame Cheikh is aiming to own, at least four or five motorbikes which he can loan to other young men like himself.  This would help them get started in business, and also increase his personal earnings.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to start a transport business.

loans.name: Mame Cheikh Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mame Cheikh Ibrahima est un jeune âgé de 32 ans qui s’active dans le transport depuis deux ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant, et habite tout près du guichet. En se tournant vers IMCEC, il aimerait acquérir une nouvelle moto djakarta pour renforcer son activité. Habitant une zone ou pratiquement la population se déplace en moto, il veut investir maximum dans cette  activité avant qu’elle ne soit saturée. Il vit en famille et ne reste pas les bras croisés car il participe mensuellement à hauteur de trente mille francs, ce qui renforce sa volonté d’aller de l’avant car il sait qu’en temps que garçon, il se doit d’appuyer ses parents qui n’ont pas les moyens.
Dans l’avenir, il pense à élargir son transport aux véhicules légers, voire lourds avec l’appui d’une Institution financière comme IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mame Cheikh Ibrahima is a thirty-two-year-old man, who has been working in transport for two years.  He is single, doesn't have any children and lives close to the field partner's office.  He has decided to work with the field partner, UIMCEC, as he would like to buy a new Djakarta motorbike to improve his business.

Mame Cheikh Ibrahima lives in an area where the vast majority of people use motorbikes for transportation.  He would like to invest the maximum possible in his business to take advantage of this situation before the market becomes saturated.

He lives with his family and works hard to contribute to their expenses.  He provides around 30,000 francs CFA a month as he knows that, as a son, he must support his parents as much as he can because their resources are very limited.

In the future, he would like to expand his business into light vehicles, and, maybe heavy vehicles too, and he intends to use the support offered by UIMCEC to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy a Djakarta motorbike for his transport business.

loans.name: Kinyengele

texts.fr: Le client Kinyengele est employé à  l’Institut Supérieur de Développement Rural. Il est parent d’un élève inscrit  régulièrement à l’université. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais academiques de son  enfant  pour qu’il ne soit plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour son  enfant. Au final, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima.
texts.en:
Kinyengele works at the Institut Supérieur de Développement Rural (Higher Institute of Rural Development).  He is the father of a student registered at the university.

Having been advised of new loan opportunities offered by the field partner, Hekima, to advance fund school fees, Kinyengele will use his loan to pay the academic fees of his son.  This will ensure that his son is not excluded from courses during the school year, 2013-2014.

Kinyengele is a parent who dreams of a better future for his child, and is extremely grateful for this special initiative from Hekima

loans.use: to pay academic fees.

loans.name: Dúo Pacorral Group

texts.es:
DUO PACORRAL
Doña Flavia es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio del Tecpan, Guatemala tiene 40 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta 1 hija menor de edad, doña flavia se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para comprar hilos para sus tejidos, también compro animales y concentrado, ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar más su negocio, ya que de esa forma ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida. en el credito anterior simpre pago puntual y no cayo en mora.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para tejidos y para la compra de animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
The "Pacorral" Duo

Flavia is originally from the village of Pacorral in Tecpan municipality in Guatemala. She is 40 years old and has one daughter in her care. Flavia makes a living producing typical knitted products by hand, and raising animals.

Flavia will use this loan in order to buy threads for her products. She will also buy animals and feed, as this is the work that helps her to get ahead.

Flavia's dream is to expand her business further. By doing this she will earn more profits and can improve her quality of life. Flavia was always punctual with the repayments on her previous loan and did not fall into debt. She will use this loan to buy basic materials for knitting products and to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for knitting products and to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Fatou, elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans le commerce de légumes et de divers (détergents : Omo, eau de javel, savon liquide). Elle  fait cela durant des années et possède un étale (comme on le voit sur la photo) dans le marché du quartier. Fatou vient pour la seconde fois solliciter un crédit de deux cents mille francs pour acheter des légumes et des divers c'est-à-dire les détergents au fin de les revendre.
Ce commerce permet à madame Fatou d’assurer la dépense quotidienne tandis que son époux se chargera des autres charges familiales : c’est comme cela que s’est organisé le foyer.
Fatou rêve d’avoir une grande cantine qui remplacerait son étale.
texts.en: Our borrower is called Fatou and she is 35 years old, married and a mother. She buys and sells vegetables and various other products (Omo washing powder, bleach, liquid soap). She has been doing this for years and has a selling space (which can be seen on the photo) in the local market. She has just requested a second loan of 200,000 francs to buy vegetables and various other products, that is to say detergents, for resale. This business allows Fatou to cover the daily outgoings while her husband covers the other family expenses; their household is organised as such. Fatou dreams of having a large shack to replace her selling space.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and various other products (detergents, liquid soap...)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.fr: Le client Oscar est employé à  l’Institut Supérieur de Développement Rural. Il est parent de 2 élèves inscrits respectivement dans des écoles secondaires de la place. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants  pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve voir ses enfants finir leurs études primaire,secondaire et universitaire. Ainsi, il remercie grandement Hekima surtout pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays de la RDC.
texts.en: The customer, Oscar, is employed by the Institut Supérieur de Développement Rural (Higher Institute of Rural Development). He is father to two pupils who are registered in local secondary schools and has been informed of new loan opportunities that IMF Hekima is offering to pre-finance school fees. This new loan will thus enable him to pay his children's school fees so that they are no longer excluded from lessons during the 2013 - 2014 school year. This parent dreams of seeing his children complete their primary, secondary and university education. He is thus extremely grateful to Hekima during this period of reconstruction of the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibrahima, 35 ans, évolue dans le commerce depuis cinq ans. Il vend des œufs, mais aussi des chaussures. Ibrahima est marié et père de famille. Il est un habitué d’IMCEC, vu qu’il est à son troisième crédit. Avant d’avoir un petit fond, Ibrahima, prenait la marchandise à crédit chez les fournisseurs qui lui donnait trois à quatre jours pour écouler la marchandise, et lui permettre de verser au cinquième jour. Ce qui semblait lourd pour lui. Depuis lors il a arrêté ce système pour recourir au crédit. Avec ce dernier, il envisage d’acheter deux cents tablettes d’œuf et 20 paires de chaussures pour honorer une commande.
Grâce à son activité, Ibrahima peut s’occuper de sa famille et de leurs besoins au quotidien.
Ibrahima nourrit le projet de devenir un grand fournisseur d’œuf, avoir son propre poulailler et ne plus avoir à aller acheter la marchandise ailleurs.
texts.en:
Ibrahima, 35 years old, has been working in commerce for five years. He sells eggs, and also shoes. Ibrahima is married and a father of a family. 

He has been with IMCEC for some time, and he is on his third loan.

Having only a small amount of funds, Ibrahima, was buying his goods on credit from suppliers who would give him three to four days to sell his stock so he could repay them on the fifth day. This was difficult, so he stopped working with this system of credit.

With this loan, he plans to buy 200 trays of eggs and 20 pairs of shoes to fill an order.

Thanks to this business, Ibrahima can take care of his family and their everyday needs.

He dreams of becoming a large supplier of eggs, where he has his own coop and does not have to buy the eggs of others.

loans.use: to buy eggs and shoes to resell

loans.name: Takku Liggey Ndargoundao Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Takku Liggey Ndargoundao regroupe cinq femmes qui évoluent dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elles se sont réunies par affinité et par voisinage.
La responsable, s’appelle Fatou, âgée de la quarantaine, elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures, tissus, sacs…Fatou recense le besoin de sa clientèle avant d’aller acheter la marchandise pour lui permettre d’écouler rapidement. L’activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et d’épargner un peu de son bénéfice.
Fatou fait de la vente ambulante, mais voudrait un jour avoir un grand magasin pour y exposer sa marchandise et avoir une renommée.
texts.en: The Takku Ligge Ndargoundao group comprises five women who have had trading businesses for several years. They have joined forces as they are all friends and/or neighbors. The person responsible for the group is Fatou, who is around 40 years old and sells shoes, fabrics and bags. Fatou finds out what her customers need before going to buy her goods so that she can sell them off quickly. This business enables her to improve her family's nutritional needs and save a little of her profit. She sells her goods on a door-to-door basis but would like one day to have a large shop where she could display her goods and have a good reputation.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabrics and bags to resell.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Fotemogoban ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou.  Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (échalotes, persils, tomates, carottes…), poissons et ignames. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er   cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (échalotes, persils, tomates, aubergines, choux, et des carottes).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  4 corbeilles composées  de carottes, d’aubergines, de choux et de tomates fraiches à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre charge l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous families, the five members of the Fotemogoban group are, on average, 36 years old and have four children. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. The group members know each other from neighborhood ties and business in the Djelibougou market.

The group members all engage in small-scale commerce, selling condiments (shallots, parsley, tomatoes, carrots…), fish, and sweet potatoes. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are their first group loan.

Fatoumata (the woman standing on the far right in the photo) sells condiments (shallots, parsley, tomatoes, eggplants, cabbage, and carrots). She plans to use her loan to buy four baskets, composed of carrots, eggplants, cabbage and fresh tomatoes from Bamako.

Sales will be made at retail in the market to customers who are mostly women. Fatoumata hopes to earn, from this loan, an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou, âgée de 34 ans, est une cliente du guichet d’IMCEC se trouvant en centre ouest du Sénégal. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et évolue dans le secteur du commerce de divers. Elle achète pour revendre des chaussures, des pochettes et des tissus teints. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis  4 ans et se procure la marchandise en capital. Aissatou loge encore chez ses parents et les appuie dans les charges de la maison. Elle se prend aussi en charge et cela avec les bénéfices générés par l’activité. Activité qu’elle veut diversifier et élargir à d’autres horizons. Par exemple, si elle avait une somme consistante, elle voyagerait et amènerait de la marchandise nouvelle.
texts.en: Aissatou, who is 34 years old, is a customer of the IMCEC branch which lies in the centre of west Senagal. She is single and has no children, and she is developing a trading activity, buying and selling a variety of products. She buys shoes, purses and dyed fabrics for resale and began this business four years ago. She gets her goods with her capital. Aissatou still lives with her parents and helps them out with the household expenses. She also provides for her own needs with the profits she generates from her business. She would like to diversify and expand her business to new horizons. For instance if she had a consistent amount of money she would travel and bring back new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy, shoes, purses and dyed fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Irabitanga Group

texts.fr:
M. Goreth fait partie du groupe Irabitanga et habite à Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Jean, un maçon. Ensemble ils sont 2 enfants âgés de 14 à 17 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, huile de palme, bière,…). 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles (riz, huile de palme, bière,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
M. Goreth belongs to the Irabitanga group and lives in Gitega. She is 38 years old and married to Jean who is a builder. They have two children aged 14 and 17 years old respectively and both children are at school.

She buys and sells shop products (rice, palm oil, beer)) and is on her eighth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of products (rice, palm oil, beer) to resell and earn more money.

In the coming years she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of products (rice, palm oil, beer) to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Mango

texts.fr: Monsieur MANGO, employé à l’institut  Supérieur de Développement  est  parent de 2 étudiants.  Ayant été sensibilisé sur le nouveau  produit credit éducation, il sollicite ce crédit pour payer les frais académiques de ces 2 enfants pour l’année 2013-2014 .  Ce parent souhaite voir ses enfants devenir des  professeurs docteur en planification  régionale.Sur ceux, il loue ce grand projet initié par Hekima qui lui permet de garantir la permanence aux cours à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mango, who works at the Institute of Higher Development [l’Institut Supérieur de Développement], is the father of two students. Having learned about the new education loan program, he is seeking a loan to pay for the school costs for his two children for the 2013-2014 academic year. 

Mango wishes to see his children earn Ph.D.s in regional planning. For this, he is borrowing with the help of Hekima so that he can ensure his children can take their courses.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for his two children's higher education

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, junto a ella vive su hijo de 24 años de edad,  quien está acompañado. Su hijo trabaja y su nuera también, de los ingresos de María solo depende sus nietas las cuales les ayuda siempre.


Ella vende productos de revista, ya tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a la actividad laboral, la necesidad de tener un ingreso en su hogar la obligo a tomar acciones por su propia cuenta, también una amiga le ayudo a establecer el contacto con los vendedores de los productos, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, antes de comenzar el negocio la señora lavaba ropa, a quien la buscaba, la distancia que recorre cada día que sale a vender es aproximadamente unos cinco kilómetros, ya que la venta la realiza de casa en casa por las colonias vecinas, no se involucra nadie más a la actividad, el horario de trabajo lo realiza de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más productos por revista como lociones, cosméticos, lencería, y en pagar una deuda que  ha adquirido en una institución financiera. Lo que desea es, cumplir un sueño de poder dedicarse a lo que le gusta e ir creciendo la clientela y tener su propio territorio de trabajo.

Seguir creciendo  poco a poco  las ventas y la clientela, tener una estabilidad mejor, espera que el negocio le dé más  resultado, con lo que le ayudara a poder tener su propio capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliación del negocio.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old.  She attended school through second grade.  She is a single mother and lives with her 24 year old son, who is married.  Her son and daughter-in-law both work, so only her granddaughters depend on her income.

She sells products from catalogs, and has done this work for more than five years.  She decided to start working because she needed an income for her household.  A friend also helped her establish contacts with the product sellers.  She does not do other work, but before starting her business she washed clothes.  When she goes out every day to sell, she travels about five kilometers, since she sells from house to house in nearby neighborhoods.  She works alone from 6:00am until 10:00am.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more products from catalogs, including lotions, cosmetics, and lingerie, and to pay a debt that she has from a financial institution.  She wants to achieve her dream of doing what she loves and growing her customer base so that she has her own sales territory.

Her sales and customer base continue growing little by little and she has better stability.  She hopes that the business will give her more results, and it will help to have her own working capital.  Her profits will be invested in loan repayments and expanding the business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from catalogs including lotions, cosmetics, and lingerie and to pay a debt that she has from a financial institution.

loans.name: Kelly Edith

texts.es: Kelly vive en la ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de música, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los equipos de música.  Kelly se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Kelly lives in the city of Cusco, located in the south of Peru.  She is an enterprising woman who makes an effort to help her family succeed and is dedicated to her work.  Her main work is providing music services.  She has been a member of the Cusco community bank for many years.  

She is requesting this loan to do maintenance on her musical instruments.  Kelly is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time and responsibly.  She is grateful to all the lenders for this loan and hopes they will continue supporting the other projects.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her musical instruments.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina vive en la ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur del Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de paquetes turísticos como por ejemplo al Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Machupicchu y entre otros lugares.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. 

Karina se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Karina lives in the city of Cusco in the south of Peru.  She is an enterprising woman who makes an effort to move her family forward and is dedicated to her work.  She works selling tourism packages to places like the Sacred Valley of the Incas, Machu Picchu, and other locations.  She has been a member of the Cusco community bank for many years.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase tourist entry tickets.  She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time and responsibly.  She is grateful to all the lenders for the loan and hopes they continue supporting projects.

loans.use: to purchase tourist entry tickets.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, es una  mujer luchadora y emprendedora, estudio hasta el cuarto grado de educación básica, casada desde hace 21 años con su esposo tiene dos hijos los cuales ya no viven con ellos, su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos.

Ella por su parte, vende tortillas en su casa de habitación, negocio en el cual se ha venido desempeñando desde hace más de 20 años, este negocio lo realiza con una vecina que le ayuda y su esposo que le ayuda con la búsqueda de la leña para el fuego donde cose las tortillas.


El préstamo será utilizado en la compra maíz para almacenarlo en esta temporada, ya que esta barato y más el que cultiva su esposo tiene  producto para seguir con su negocio para lo que resta del año.

La cliente de momento manifiesta, que lo que quiere es que Dios le preste fuerzas para seguir adelante en el negocio y cuidando a su esposo, ya que a sus hijos con lucha y esfuerzo los lograron sacar adelante.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who attended school through fourth grade.  She has been married for 21 years and she and her husband have two children who do not live with them.  Her husband works as a farmer growing basic grains.

She works selling tortillas from her home.  She has done this work for more than 20 years.  She has help from a neighbor and her husband helps by searching for wood for the fire where she cooks the tortillas.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase corn in season to store for later, since it is less expensive now.  With the corn her husband grows, she will have enough product to continue with her business for the rest of the year.  

María says that she hopes God gives her strength to continue forward with her business and cares for her husband and children, since she will fight and make an effort to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Om-Ashjan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Ashjan and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Afrah is 34 years old. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had a great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. 

Afrah is a sewer. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. Because her work is recognized as being of good quality, she has acquired good customers recently. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER to purchase sewing items for her business. Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing items for her business.

loans.name: Al-Wafaq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wafaq, and it consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Khiria is the leader of this group. She is a 50-year-old married woman with children. She is a very active woman, but she is uneducated and from a poor family.

She is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family. With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of her house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  vive en la hermosa  ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de chicha de jora, ella tiene una pequeña picantería (Picantería lugar donde se preparara y vende chicha de Jora).  Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar chicha de jora como por ejemplo azúcar, maíz entre otros. 

Marina se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Marina lives in the lovely city of Cusco in southern Peru. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works diligently and sacrifices in order to provide for her family. Marina runs a business selling chicha de jora [traditional corn liquor]. She owns a small pub where she prepares and sells the chicha.

Marina has been a member of the Cusco Communal Bank for several years and is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for the preparation of chicha, such as corn, sugar, and other ingredients. 

Marina is pleased at being able to have a loan and is committed to making her payments promptly and responsibly. She would like to thank lenders for providing the loan and hopes that they continue to support other projects.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, hombre luchador y emprendedor dedicado al trabajo agrícola, estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo varón el cual está estudiando primer año de bachillerato.

José trabaja en un corral, en el cual tiene más de dos años de estar trabajando, su trabajo esta relaciona al que aprendió de pequeño junto a su padre,  quien de pequeño le enseño el trabajo agrícola y le está enseñando ahora a su hijo a cultivar la tierra.


El préstamo será utilizado una parte en la preparación (desgranado, picado de sacate) y recolección de la cosecha y el resto del crédito será invertido en la reparación de la vivienda.

A futuro quiere que su vivienda este en mejores condiciones para su familia, que estén protegidos y que su hijo logre culminar sus estudios de bachillerato para que luego ingrese a la universidad y logre culminar su carrera y verlo convertirse en todo un profesional académico.
texts.en:
José, age 41, is a tenacious and enterprising farmer.  He went to school through the fifth grade.  He lives with his life partner and his son.  His son is in his first year of high school.  José works on a farm, and he has been doing this work for over two years.  He learned this work from his father.  When José was little, his father taught him agricultural work.  Now, he is teaching his son how to cultivate the land.

He will use part of the loan to prepare (threshing, chopped grass) and to gather the harvest.  He will use the rest of the loan to repair the house.

In the future he wants his house to be in better condition for his family so that they will be protected.  He wants his son to complete high school so that he can then attend the university.  He wants him to get his degree, and he wants to see him become a complete academic professional.

loans.use: to prepare for and gather the harvest and to repair the house.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Ben est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 2 enfant.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Habits, Ustensiles, Glacière et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt de groupe. 
Awa  assise au milieu est la vendeuse de Glacières et Tasses du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des glacières de différents formats, des tasses thermos et des bols. Elle se procure de ces articles à Bamako. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
"Ben" is an association of women from the Koko district, Koutiala City. They know one another and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 43 years of age, are married, and have at least two children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing, utensils, insulated containers, and more.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 15th group loan. 

Awa, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, is a vendor of insulated containers and basins in the group. She intends to use her loan to purchase insulated containers and basins. She gets her supplies of these goods in Bamako. She sells them to a diverse customer base at the house and at the market.

While the other members of the group Ben plan on making an average profit of 155,000 francs CFA each over the course of the loan cycle, Ms. Awa plans on making 170,000 francs. In addition to paying back the loan, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They wish to bolster this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their stock goods will not be scarce.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of household goods, such as insulated containers, basins, and bowls

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Lolo est majoritairement composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de  condiments (tomates, oignons, échalotes, choux, poudre de cube Maggi et  des concentrées de tomates). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Habi (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates, oignons séchés, aubergines…) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 corbeilles de tomates, 5 sacs d’échalotes et 5 sacs d’oignons séchés à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djelibougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Hadi espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Lolo is mostly composed of polygamous women, who average 31 years of age and five children each, all living in Djelibougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments: tomatoes, onions, shallots, cabbage, Maggi cube powder [bouillon cubes], and tomato paste. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Habi (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is famous for selling condiments (tomatoes, dried onions, eggplant,…. ) of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes, 5 sacks of shallots, and 5 sacks of dried onions in Bamako. Retail sales are made to a mixed customer base in Djelibougou.

With this loan, Ms. Hadi hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase a residential plot of land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomatoes, onions, and eggplant

loans.name: Dúo La Familia De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO LA FAMILIA DE DIOS
La señora  Martina de 38 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, esta solicitando un crédito nuevamente para invertir en su actividad que es cultivo y también se dedica a otra actividad como, tortillería, ya que es madre soltera y dia a dia tiene que luchar para salir adelante con su familia, les agradese por su ayuda brindada en el credito anterior esperando nuevamente que le puedan  ayudar para seguir adelante en su actividad de cultivo.
texts.en:
La Familia de Dios Duo

Martina, 38, has earned a living in agriculture for several years.  She's requesting a new loan to invest in her crop.  She also works another job as a tortilla maker because she's a single mother who strives every day to get ahead with her family.

She's grateful for the help with the previous loan and hopes for more help to keep moving forward with her farming work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gnongonkanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gnongonkanou est composé majoritairement de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou, un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (ail, tomate, persil…), oignon et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (ail, tomate, persil…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d’ail, 10corbeilles de tomate et 1 corbeille de persil à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djelibougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sali espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Gnongonkanou is mostly composed of polygamous women, who average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in Djelibougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments: garlic, tomatoes, parsley, …), and onions, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sali (standing at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling condiments (garlic, tomatoes, parsley, …). She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 bags of garlic, 10 baskets of tomatoes, and a basked of parsley, in Bamako. Retail sales are made to a mixed customer base in Djelibougou.

With this loan, Ms. Sali hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as garlic, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Tayor Aljanna Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tayor Aljanna, which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work hard as much they can to offer a good life for their families. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Amah is the leader of this group. She is 47 years old and an uneducated woman. Her life conditions prevented her from completing her higher education. She is a housewife who wishes her family to grow up well and have a better education.

Recently, the weather has been cold in her city, and she intends to buy supplies for her house, so she applied for a loan to buy a water heater to use for her bathroom. This will enable her family to live with more comfort and will help her to get hot water.

She hopes to establish a retail shop in order to have daily income and to live comfortably with her family.

She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to buy a water heater to use for her bathroom.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan also helped in her everyday expenditures at home. She also used her loan in her other businesses such as frozen foods and a fruits and vegetables stand. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their family's needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife hopes to have another branch and dreams to be successful in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Al-Aeaz Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Aeaz and consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 180,000 YER. Fatima is 26 years old and married. She is a housewife who exerts herself in order to raise her child and to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself. Due to the high cost of goods, it is not enough to cover her household needs. She has requested a loan to buy home appliances to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her child in a private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.name: Leah Lynne

texts.en: Leah Lynne is 22 years old, married and has been in the direct selling cosmetic sales business for one year. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy perfumes, lotions, deodorants, lipsticks and dresses to sell. She hopes to obtain a loan in order to earn enough income for her family's needs. Leah Lynne knows that this financial support will help her to improve her business. She believes that through the loan, she will improve her income and be able to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, deodorants, cleaners and dresses to sell

loans.name: Welita

texts.en: Welita is a hog raiser within her locality. She is 51 years old and a mother who has been blessed with five children. She and her husband dream of becoming financially stable someday. With regard to this matter, she plans to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. To further obtain her goal, she is seeking a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through this financial assistance she requested, she will be able to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells doormats and she has a reloading station for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jolly hopes that her business will last a long time and she dreams to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. These fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 24-year-old divorced lady. She is responsible for supporting four members of her family, which is a heavy burden she has to overcome through developing her business to make sure that she'll stay capable of replying to their needs and satisfying their desires.

Amani has been preparing and selling special perfume scents in addition to selling cosmetics and purses for 7 years. She used to work as a hairdresser before. In 2013, she established her current business to improve her living conditions. She needs to develop her business as much as she can to make sure that it will provide a good income that's enough to cover her family's increasing needs.

Today Amani is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special release perfume collection. There are special offer prices before the coming spring and summer season – especially before Mother's Day, which is celebrated on the 21st of March in Lebanon.

Amani is planning to open a beauty salon in the future that will include her current business and other beauty services that complete each other.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special release perfume collection

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato, 35 years of age, is still single and harmoniously residing in his cozy village together with his parents. 

He has been managing a hog-raising business for almost one year and enjoying it every single day of his life, but due to insufficient funds to continue his business he would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase hog feeds to supplement the needs of his hogs. 

He's hoping that his requested capital will be granted so that he can utilize it immediately on his hog-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds to supplement the needs of his hogs.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ramona dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her family a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina 42, offers manicures and pedicures in the morning, while she sells barbecue, hotdogs and other“ihaw-ihaw” in the afternoon to help her husband generate income. With the support of her husband, she works hard to promote their quality lifestyle. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pork, ketchup, salt, pepper, and soy sauce to process barbecue.  She will be grateful if her request loan will be granted. This amount of loan will be used solely for her food production sales business. She hopes that she will be able to offer more delicious barbecue and probably increase her sales daily.

loans.use: to purchase pork, ketchup, salt, pepper, and soy sauce

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is 39 years old, married, and supports a family of five members.  His spouse is Rodah and she also contribute a monthly income to the family.  They are blessed with five children aged between 6 and 18 years old. Cosmas has been selling fuels like kerosene, diesel and petrol in Biretwo location for the last five years, earning an income of KES 40,000 monthly.

He is now requesting his eighth term loan of KES 80,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to purchase more stock of fuel for resale.  

The anticipated profit amounts will be used to repay the loan. His hopes and dreams are to excel in both business and family.

loans.use: To expand his current business of selling fuel

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie, 36, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rico, an employee, and is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Margie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Margie hopes to have a larger network and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdulkaream Group

texts.en: Abdulkaream group consists of four women who are friends from the same village. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the member's activity level. Laila is the leader of the group. She is 31 years old. She has been selling clothes in her own region for one year. She is a professional in this field and her goods are required in the market. She has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income.  Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married lady, aged 31, and blessed with one child who is eight years old and whom she supports.  She sells second-hand clothes in Kabarnet location and has been in operation for a period of 12 years, earning an income of KES.15,000 monthly.

With her sixth loan of KES. 52,000 from VisionFund Kenya, she intends to purchase more bales of second hand clothes for resale. The anticipated amounts she obtains will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to excel in both her family and business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Perpetue Blandine

texts.fr: Blandine est un jeune femme de 36 ans, mariée mère  de deux enfants qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend les vêtements dans un marché de la capitale depuis 11 ans. Son activté fonctionne normalement, mais elle est obligé à chaque fois d'aller au déballage tous les samedi pour avoir de quoi exposer dans sa boutique. Ceci est dû à la petitesse de son capital, d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activté en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'acheter un bon ballot de vêtement pour sa boutique. ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Blandine is a young woman of 36, who is married with two children who attend school. She is a storekeeper and opened a shop  in which she sells clothes at a market in the capital 11 years ago. Her business is doing well, but every Saturday she has to go to the wholesale market to buy the inventory for her shop. This is because she has very limited working capital. This loan is very important to her for it will allow her to purchase a large bale of clothes for resale in her shop, which will in turn increase her sales and profits. She plans to invest a part of the profits back into the business and use the rest to take care of her own and her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 34 years old, married and supports a family of four. Her two children are aged eight and four years old. To make a living, she sells second hand clothing in Kabarnet, Kenya, and has been doing this for three years, earning an income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is now servicing her third loan of 52,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and wishes to use this amount to purchase a fridge for her family. The profits she earns from the business will be used to expand it, as well as to improve the living standards of her family.

Her dream is to see her business grow and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for her family

loans.name: Handomah

texts.en:
Handomah is a 20-year-old single lady who has been running her accessories and perfume selling shop for four years, to support her family in a well-managed way.

Handomah is working on developing her business gradually through acquiring loans from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because her business needs an external financial push to develop it further, since her income is barely covering her family's needs and she has to do something better to improve their lives.

Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Al Majmoua, which is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, in order to increase her business merchandise with specially-released accessories in time for Mother's Day which is on the 21st March in Lebanon.

Handomah is optimistic, and she believes that one day she'll expand and develop her business to start wholesale trade and satisfy her beloved family's needs.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise of perfume and accessories

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala ville qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que condiments, Fruits et Légumes, Tasses, Bois de chauffage, Produits Cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Fatoumata  debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la  droite, vend  du bois de chauffe et des fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 2 chargements de charrettes en différents fruits et légumes. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  125 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of women from Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and parents.
This group of women sells things such as condiments, fruit and vegetables, cups, firewood, cosmetic products and various articles. To expand their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second group loan.
Fatoumata   is standing second from the left, she sells firewood and fruit and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy five cartloads of firewood, and two cartloads of various fruits and vegetables. She buys the stock at Koutiala. She sells her wares from home and at the market to a mixed clientele.
Whereas the other members of the Sabaly group expect to make an average profit of 120 000CFA per month each during this loan period, Mme Fatoumata hopes to make 125 000FCFA per month.
In addition to the repayment of the loan, they will use part of the income to cope with personal expenses, and to increase their capital.
They would like to reinforce this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as not to be short of stock.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
Wilian es un joven de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos.
 
Wilian trabaja como vendedor de repuestos en la ciudad donde reside,  ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, este trabajo lo aprendió por sí mismo, ya que al terminar de estudiar, decidió buscar trabajo y en esa tienda de repuestos había necesitaban un joven con ganas de trabajar, fue así que  le dieron a él la oportunidad, el lugar donde realiza esta actividad está a una distancia de 45 minutos de su casa, él viaja en una motocicleta y el horario en el que labora es de 7AM a 4PM, también sale a dejar repuestos a domicilios a los lugares cercanos. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar un carro y transportarse del trabajo a su casa,  pues él siente que andar en motocicleta es muy peligroso y además muchas veces sale tarde del trabajo, por eso desea comprar un carro, pues le ha llegado una oferta de un carro usado que está en buenas condiciones  y él quiere aprovechar

Uno de sus sueños, es poder estudiar y prepararse, para que en un futuro llegue a tener su propia tienda de repuestos, pues le gusta mucho la automotriz y le gustaría estudiar esa carrera, y además con su trabajo actual está ganando mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Wilian is 23 years old and completed high school. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. 

Wilian makes a living selling spare parts in the city where he lives. He has been working with this business for three years, having learned the trade on his own. When he left school Wilian decided to look for a job. This spare parts shop needed a young person with a desire to work and they gave Wilian the opportunity. Wiilian's work is 45 minutes away from his home. He travels there by motorcycle and works from 7am until 4pm. He also goes out to sell spare parts to nearby homes.

Wiliam is applying for a loan as he needs to buy a car to go between his work and his home. Wilian feels that travelling by motorcycle is very dangerous and, on many occasions, he leaves work late. He wants to buy a car as he been offered a second-hand one that is in good conditions and he wants to take advantage of this offer.

One of Wilian's dream is to be able to study so that, in the future, he can have his own spare parts shop. Wilian really likes mechanics and he would like to study for a degree in the subject. With his current job, Wilian is gaining a lot of experience in the field.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es:
María es una señora de 67 años de edad, casada junto a su pareja procrearon tres hijos, ella estudio hasta el segundo grado de educacion basica; es una señora muy luchadora que se dedica a los oficios de la casa y asi mismo al cuido de ganado y de una granja que tiene junto a uno de sus hijos.

Ella tiene mas de seis años de dedicarse a esta actividad a la compra y venta de ganado y tambien de pollos, sus otros dos hijos, uno de ellos es motorista y la otra muchacha trabaja de oficios domesticos en otros hogares.

El financiamiento que ella tramita con CREDICAMPO, lo utilizara para la compra de una vaca y mejorara el negocio de la granja, asi obtendra mayores ingresos y  mejor calidad de vida junto a sus hijos. Ella en el futuro pretende tener una granja mucho mas amplia, mejorar su vivienda para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 67 years old. She is married and, with her husband, has three children. She studied up to second grade at primary school. María is a very plucky woman who carries out all the household chores. She also looks after cattle and has a farm with one of her children.

María has been doing this work - buying and selling cattle and also chickens - for six years. One of her children is a driver while her daughter is a domestic servant. 

María will use this loan from "CrediCampo" to buy a cow and to improve her farm. She will then earn a higher income and improve her and her children's quality of life. In the future María intends to buy a much larger farm and to improve her home so that her family can live more comfortably.
