loans.use: to buy a cow and improve her chicken farm.

loans.name: Al-Qaser Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Qaser and it consists of four ladies. Hanan is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She runs a business selling different types of sweets and fried food. 

Since she had a small business and there wasn't another bakery in the area, she attracted customers by making tasty sweets and fried food for them. Hanan not only uses her business as a source of income but also for social purposes, including providing the poor with sweets and fried food, especially during festivals and weddings seasons. 

Recently, Hanan's business has decreased leading to a decline in her profits. She has had to stop providing her products to poor people because of the current situation facing Yemen. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to purchase sweets and fried food ingredients to use for her business. She hopes to increase her profits and continue providing sweets at social occasions.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and fried food ingredients to use for her business.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is 28 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Artem has a vocational education and he attended accounting courses, but he never worked as an accountant. Artem lives with his parents.  His father is a taxi driver and uses Artem’s car for his work, and his mother is a housewife. It has been five years that Artem has had his own business.  In their garage, he does car exterior design and car repairing activities.
 Lately Artem has bought a crashed car and he wants to repair it, change the exterior and sell it with a possible profit. For this he asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to start repairing activities, since he needs to buy spare parts and paint for that car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and paint for that car

loans.name: Alhanna Group

texts.en: The four members of the Alhanna Group are women. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood in the city of Hodeidah, Yemen. They have many clients. The whole group took out a loan of 110,000 YER. Raba`a is 31 years old. She is a person who distributes different items, such as ladies clothes, to different retail shops for resale. She would like to ask for financial assistance because her household expenses are continually increasing. So now, she is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, she is asking for a loan  from AMB. The loan will be used to buy fabrics to sell to retail shops. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell to retail shops.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a lady of twenty eight years, married to Geoffrey and a mother of one child. She runs a boutique in Kiambu and has been in this business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Lucy's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy new stock for her business; in future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock like shoes and clothes.

loans.name: 01.05.03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a retail business selling dry food and general goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase general goods and dry food for resale.  Phương is 41 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Phương is the group leader of the 01.05.03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members.  Phương lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for two years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  In the future, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase general goods and dry food for resale.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina was born in 1971. She is divorced and raises a 12-year-old child .

Nigina  sells soap, pride, shampoo, and food items as pasta, butter, sugar, and biscuits. Nigina began her business 13 years ago because she needed money. She began her business selling biscuits. Little by little, she developed her business and it is going well. She has regular customers. 

Nigina asks for 5,000 JTS to buy food items as candies, sugar, pasta, etc. to increase her working capital. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items such as candies, sugar, and pasta  to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa lives in Lernagog village with her 23-year-old son and 22-year-old daughter. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and time to time, he financially supports his family.

Alisa herself has been involved in agriculture. Specifically, she keeps livestock which includes cows, sheep, pigs, piglets and chickens. Alisa's son helps her with the livestock and they work hard to earn enough income and sustain their living. Now, Alisa applied for this loan to be able to purchase six oxen and forage for the livestock. The loan will increase her livestock so she will be able to gather more agricultural income. Alisa hopes that lenders will support her loan of 3,000 USD.
 
Alisa has taken a loan from local financial institutions before but because of difficult financial conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, she is sure that her agribusiness is successful enough to cover monthly payments, and Alisa has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for six oxen and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Mushtaq

texts.en:
Mushtaq is a 44-year-old active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He has five children and is responsible for managing his house hold. 

Mushtaq is a professional carpenter and has run his carpentry business for many years.

Mushtaq wants to expand his business to meet the demands of his customers. He needs to buy different types of merchandises such as pieces of wood in bulk, cutter blades, needles and other relevant tools and accessories. Due to financial constraints, he is not in position to buy this merchandise.
Therefore he requests  100,000 PKR from Kiva S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to expand the size of his business and help him buy necessary merchandise.

Mushtaq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand his carpentry business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 43 years old and operates food production business.  She makes “suman” to sell in her village.  She has been engaged to this kind of business for more than two years.  She plans to offer native rice cakes “kakanin” to earn a greater income but does not have enough capital.  She's requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients such as milk, sugar, glutinous rice (malagkit rice) and cornstarch for  her food production business.

She hopes that her loan request will be approved in order to provide the needs of her six children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as milk, sugar, glutinous rice ( malagkit rice) and cornstarch use for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en: Ma. Rebecca is 28 years old from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages four through eight. For seven years now, Ma. Rebecca has made baskets for a living. This is her way of helping her husband, who is a driver, to earn an income and raise their family. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy buri (native palm) and the straw that is necessary in making baskets. She hopes that with the loan, she can prepare everything that is necessary, so she can be more productive. She dreams of seeing her children have a good education and a secure future.

loans.use: to buy buri (native palm) and straw.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been married for 15 years and has four children. He is 44 years old. His eldest son is going to tenth grade, another son is going to ninth grade, and the youngest son is going to fifth grade. Ali’s daughter goes to seventh grade, and she is playing the piano well. He has been an Internally Displaced Person (along with the rest of his family) from the occupied territory of Kalbajar for 21 years. Now they are living in Baku region. 

Ali has been in the taxi driver business for many years. Today he wants to repair his car and for this reason Ali applied to the Komak company. Ali needs a loan in the amount of 800 Azerbaijan New Manat to buy a new car motor. For this help he is thankful to the Kiva organization and all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new car motor for his taxi

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: Malohat was born in 1970. She is married and a careful mother of three children who are schoolboys. Her husband works in Ukraine. She is going to organize her own business because the money that is sent by her husband is not enough for living. She is going to organize a business that sells women’s clothes. She works sometimes as a seller, which is why she has good experience. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy women’s clothes, which she will sell in a local market. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes to start a new business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 35-years-old and she is already a rather successful business lady. She lives in the city of Ijevan in the Tavush region. She is married and has two children. Anna has a specialty of pedagogue, but now she has a small office where she realizes the sale of bus tickets to the Russian Federation.  She also translates documents, scans documents and also makes copies of documents. She is a director of this office. Her husband works with her and helps her very much.

Anna asks for a loan of 1,200,000 Armenian drams in order to buy new computers, a new table, several chairs for her office and also a cabinet for documents.

loans.use: to buy new computers, a new table, several chairs for her office and also a cabinet for documents

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La joven Ana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 4 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
Doña Ana necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como arroz, azúcar, café, frijoles, pan, manteca, huevos, aguas, refrescos, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo. 
Doña Ana con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta ayuda poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Ana espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
The young Ana is a hard working and responsible person who resides in a community in southern Honduras with her family. For the last 4 years, she has operated a general store in her home in the municipality where she lives.

Ana needs a loan to purchase more products such as rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, butter, eggs, waters, soft drinks, etc., in orderrto continue her business.

Anna wants to expand sales and this will help, since she doesn't have the products she needs to comply with customers' daily requests. This loan will improve her family's quality of life by increasing household income.

Ana hopes in a short while to be able to expand her business and, thus, continue helping her family, so that her children may receive the necessary schooling and greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, butter, eggs, waters, soft drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 40 años de edad, por circunstancias de la vida no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es una madre soltera que tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela.     

Su situación de madre soltera, no le ha impedido a Santos trabajar duro para mantener a sus hijos, es por eso que ella tiene un cafetin en la escuela de la comunidad, inició este trabajo este año, también tiene negocio en la casa, el que lo ha tenido toda su vida. 
La necesidad sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, fue la que llevó a Santos a realizar la actividad a la que se dedica, la escuela donde tiene el chalet, le queda a unos 500 metros de su casa, ella paga quien le ayude en el negocio y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM a 4 PM.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, será invertido en la compra de bebidas, golocinas, carnes, verduras, helados, etc.  Con lo que ampliara las ventas, tendrá más ingresos y cumplirá su deseo de poder dedicarse a lo que le gusta.

Santos tiene como propósito continuar con el cafetin y que sea más rentable, tener una mejor estabilidad económica, para que de esta forma no le falte la ayuda a sus hijos para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old. She did not have the opportunity to attend school because of the circumstances of her life. She is a single mother with three children who are studying in school. Her situation as a single mother has not prevented her from working hard in order to support her children.  

This is why she has opened a little café in the community school this year, in addition to the business that she has had in her house all of her life; having to raise her children on her own is what motivated Santos to do the work that she does. The school where she has her little café is about 500 meters from her house, and she pays someone to help her in the business. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. 

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo will be invested in the purchase of beverages, snacks, meat, vegetables, frozen treats, etc.  With this, she will increase her sales and have more income; and accomplish her goal of being able to do the work that she likes.

Santos’ goal is to continue with the café and make it more profitable, and to have better financial stability so that her children will have help completing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, snacks, meat, vegetables, frozen treats, etc. to sell in the café.

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is 22-years-old.  He lives with his wife and his three children in Ramallah, a Palestinian city in the central West Bank located 10 km north of Jerusalem, adjacent to al-Bireh.  It currently serves as the de facto administrative capital of the State of Palestine.  He works as a driver in the city.  His dream is to see his house complete because he lives in a rented house now which is so small.

Subhi is asking Ryada for this loan to pave his house and install doors.  This will help him to take step forward, because he has a shortage of money to buy the materials he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to pave his house and install doors

loans.name: Abbe

texts.fr: Abbe est une femme mariée de 57 ans mère de famille. Elle fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes, tomates, gombo et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 11 ans. Elle a un bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick up de régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abbe is 57 years old, married, and a mother of a family. She has been selling seasonal fresh foods (manioc, plantains, palm nuts, tomatoes, gumbo, and fruits) at a local market for 11 years. She has a good relationship with her suppliers, and also, especially, her customers who she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in this area.

Abbe would like to purchase bunches of plantains so that she will have enough stock to better satisfy her customers' constant demand. This will also help her avoid gaps in her stock.

Abbe will save her earnings, not only so she can expand her business but also so that she can support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of plantains for resale.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a married Iraqi youth client who is 30 years old and has three children. Ismael works hard to provide for his family. He is its sole support. 

Ismael owns a carpenter’s shop. He specializes in making furniture. Ismael has been in this field since 2006 and through practice he gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee and is well-known in his neighborhood thanks to his competitive and affordable prices. 

Ismael is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a piece of machinery specialized for his work. Ismael is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of machinery specialized for his work.

loans.name: Nicodeme

texts.fr: Nicodème est un jeune homme  de 30 ans fiancé et père de 2 enfants de 1 et 5 ans. Il est  commerçant et fait la vente en détail des vivres secs (arachide) dans un marché de la place depuis 13 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai acheter des filets d'arachide pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Nicodème is a young man, 30 years old, engaged, and a father of two children, who are one and five years old. He is a merchant and has been selling dried foods (nuts) in a local market for 13 years. He has a good relationship with his suppliers, and also, especially, his customers who who he has acquired over time thanks to his experience in this area. 

Nicodème would like to buy groundnuts so that he will have enough stock to better satisfy her customers. This will also help him avoid gaps in his stock. 

He will save his earnings so that he not only can expand his business but also support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working in agriculture since seven years ago to help her beloved husband in raising their children properly and covering their needs.

Joumana is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new irrigating system which is necessary for improving her agricultural business production.

This is Joumana's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she is very anxious about this loan because she believes that it will help her develop her business properly and achieve her required goals and future development plans.

Joumana is planning to expand her working zone to increase her production in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new irrigating system which is necessary for improving her agricultural business production

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
ADAMA est vers 1981 à DIALA, cercle de BANKASS, une des préfectures de la 5ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr ADAMA est âgé de 33 ans avec 1 enfant. Il réside à BOUGOULA et il vit dans une famille  monogame.
Mr ADAMA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de pièces  détachées d’engins à deux roues. 
Fort de ses 7 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième  prêt.
Mr ADAMA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 colis de pièces détachées. Il s’approvisionne à FAKOLA et à BAMAKO. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant  au marché. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes.
Mr ADAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Adama was born in 1981 in Diala, in Bankass, one of the prefectures in the fifth administrative region in Mali. Adama is 33 years old and has one child. He lives in Bougoula in a monogamous family. 

Adama is interested in business, notably the buying and selling of spare parts for motorcycles. With seven years experience behind him, he is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase his business capital and to better satisfy his customers, who continue to grow in number. He is on his fourth loan.

Adam plans to use his loan to buy five boxes of spare parts. He procures his goods in Fakola and Bamako, and makes his sales for cash at the market. His customers are men.

Adama hopes to earn a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA, which he will use to support the needs of his family, pay back his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a young and purposeful woman. She is 23 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has been busy with selling women's shawls in a local market. Nargiza has been busy with this business for more than two years. She has her own selling place. Nargiza also sells threads, needles, etc. Her business is the main of source of income for the family. Her parents have a small income. 

She is going to develop this business, and in this way, improve their living conditions. She must buy goods for the new spring season. She is asking for a loan of $800 USD to buy women’s shawls. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s shawls for the new season

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 71 years old and married.  His children are grown up. James supports his wife, who also takes care of the family farm. James owns a retail shop in Kabarnet town and has been in this business over a period of more than 18 years, earning an income of KES.15,000.

With this sixth loan of KES.100,000 from VisionFund Kenya, he wishes to purchase a variety of stock for his retail shop.  The profits he earns from the business will be used to purchase food and clothing for his family.  His dream is to expand his business and support his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Bajame

texts.en: Again Bajame, whose name in English means "almond", wants to buy seeds for planting.  According to her, she has already prepared the soil and is good to go.

loans.use: To purchase potato and onion seeds to plant.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en: Rani lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a married woman. Her husband owns a clothing business in the market. He is a very hard working person. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market. He sells a variety to his customers. Presently, he does not have enough money to purchase more variety to sell. Therefore his wife Rani, as a member of a two person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. With the help of the loan amount he will purchase a variety of clothes and sell them in the main market at a profitable price.  Rani is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en:
Pakiza has been an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city for more than 21 years. Now she is living at Mahmudlu village in the Fuzuli region with her family. Pakiza is 57 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are married. Her youngest child studies at a technical college. Pakiza has been in the animal-breeding business for many years. Today she needs a loan to buy hay, straw, etc. for cows.

She has applied for a loan of 2,150 AZN. This is Pakiza’s second loan. Her first loan stimulated her business, and Pakiza is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy hay, straw, etc.

loans.name: Chata

texts.fr:
CHATA est née en 1975 à DIVO (république de la COTE D’IVOIRE. Mme CHATA avec ses 39 ans a 8 enfants et réside à FAKOLA une des sous-préfectures de la 3eme région administrative du MALI.
Mme CHATA  s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la restauration. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA.  
Forte de ses 15 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième  prêt.
Mme CHATA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de riz et 5 colis de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant  au marché. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mme CHATA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Chata was born in 1975 in Divo (in the Ivory Coast). She is 39 years old, has eight children, and now lives in Fakola, one of the sous-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. 

Chata works preparing and selling food for a living. She sells what she makes in Fakola. With 15 years experience behind her, she is now collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase her business capital in order to better satisfy her customers, who do not stop growing in number. Chata is on her fourth loan.

With this loan, she plans to buy 20 bags of rice and 5 boxes of condiments. She procures these goods in Fakola. She makes her sales for cash at the market to a mixed group of customers.

Chata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will use to support the needs of her family, pay back her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
DJIBRIL est en 1981 à KATIOLA (république de la COTE D’IVOIRE. Mr DJIBRIL est âgé de 33 ans, il est marié avec 2 femmes et a 1 enfant. Il réside à MENA dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr DJIBRIL s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de produits divers .Sa vente se fait à MENA.  
Fort de ses 9 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  cinquième  prêt.
Mr DJIBRIL compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de sucre ; 1 bidon d’huile et 10 casiers de boissons. Il s’approvisionne à KOUMANTOU. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant  chez lui-même à la maison. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mr DJIBRIL espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Djibril was born in 1981 in Katiola (in the Ivory Coast). He is 33 years old, married with two wives, and has one child. He lives in Mena in a traditional family.

Djibril works buying and selling various goods for a living. With nine years experience behind him, he is now collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his business capital in order to meet the needs of his customers, who do not stop growing in number. He is on his fifth loan.

Djibril plans to use his loan to buy three sacs of rice, three sacs of sugar, one drum of oil, and ten cases of drinks. He procures his goods in Koumantou. He makes his sales for cash in Mena from his home to a mixed group of customers.

Djibril hopes to earn a monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to support the needs of his family, pay back his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various shop goods

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol  vive en la hermosa  ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es el bordado con hilos y realiza por ejemplo de cojines, alfombras, mantas, capas, manteles y otros con hilos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar hilos. 

Marisol  se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, located in southern Peru. She is an enterprising woman who advances her family by the effort and dedication of her work. Her principal economic activity is embroidering with thread. Marisol makes, for example, cushions, carpets, blankets, capes, tablecloths and other embroidery. She has belonged to the “Cusco” Communal Bank for many years now and on this opportunity she needs the loan to purchase thread.

Marisol is content with the loan and she promises to make her payments punctually and with much responsibility. She is grateful to all the investors for this loan and she urges them to continue supporting all the other projects.

loans.use: to buy thread for embroidery to sell.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina vive en la hermosa  ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal preparar  platos de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante y  en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, verduras y carnes. 

Rosalbina se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Rosalbina lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. She is an enterprising woman who helps her family get ahead by the effort and dedication she puts into her work. Her main economic activity is preparing meals as she has a small restaurant, and in her spare time she makes craft items. She has been a member of the "Cusco" communal bank for several years, and this time she wants a loan to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and meat.

Rosalbina is happy about the loan and undertakes to make her repayments on time and responsibly. She is grateful to all the lenders for the loan and she she wants them to continue supporting the other projects.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Gofran

texts.en:
Gofran is a 50 year-old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of five children and by profession he is an owner of an auto spare parts shop.  He has been running his business for the past five-ten years. Gofran wants to expand the size of his business so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better selling services of auto spare parts.  However, due to financial problems he is not in a position to bear these expenses.
Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva SEP loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expenses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers needs. Of this financial assistance, Gofran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy auto spare parts

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio Roberto se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende mantas,gorros y chompas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar chompas,mantas y gorras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Robert continues to work selling artisan crafts; he sells blankets, caps, and sweaters.  He works from eight o’clock in the morning until six o’clock in the evening.  He wants to use this business to get ahead.  Robert’s dream is to expand his artisan craft business.  He is asking for this loan to buy sweaters, blankets, and caps.

He is happy to have the loan and is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blankets, and caps.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine is a 30-year-old nice lady who lives in the village of Aknaghbyur in the Tavush region of Armenia. She is a mother of three elfish boys. She has a big family since they live with her parents-in-law too. 

Tehmine’s husband has his own minibus on which he transfers passengers from the village to Ijevan city and back. Tehmine used to work at the school, but now she is a housewife, and, together with all the members of her family, she is engaged in farming and agriculture. On their farm they have a cow, a calf and 35 chickens. They also have a plot of land and a very nice fruit garden where they have peach, persimmon, plum, fig, apricot, and apple trees.

Thanks to their hale and group work they manage to have a perfect and tasty yield. They sell their fruit at the city wholesale market. This is the only source of income for this big family.

Tehmine is asking for a loan of 200,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy fodder for their farm cattle and chickens and to repair the fence of their fruit garden.

loans.use: to buy fodder for their farm cattle and chickens and repair the fence of their fruit-garden.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une veuve âgée de 55 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 24 et 36 ans et parmi lesquels  deux vont encore à l'école.Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 8 ans où elle vend des fruits  et des vivres secs(farine de manioc)en fonction des saisons. La durée moyenne de rotation de son stock est de 3 jours.elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit  pour mieux s'approvisionner en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle grandissante et d'accroître son bénéfice.Bénéfice qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de réinvestir dans son activité dans le but de l'agrandir car elle a pour ambition d'occuper la position de leader dans ce secteur d'activité.
texts.en:
Bernadette is 55 years old, a widow, and a mother of three children, who age between 24 and 36 years old. Two of her children are still in school.

Bernadette has been a merchant at the local market for eight years, where she sells seasonal fruits and dried goods (manioc flour). Her average turn-over of stock is about three days.

She is seeking a new loan in order to procure a large quantity of goods which will allow her to better satisfy her customers, who are growing in number, and to increase her earnings.

These earnings will allow her to support the needs of her family and to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to one day be a leader is this area of business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles thanks the Kiva lenders for lending towards his previous loan. His output increased and so did sales.  He managed to pay his children's tuition in time and also do his loan repayment.
 He is acquiring this loan to boost his farming business by buying manure and insecticides, and he said his clients are residents and traders from nearby villages.
His hopes for the future are to enlarge his farming business and educate his children.  The challenges he faces are unfavorable weather conditions and lack of enough capital. He describes himself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 34 years old. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.  Her husband is a welder by profession, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a welding plant. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase welding plant. Therefore his wife, Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner , BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. Yasmeen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant.

loans.name: Shirmo

texts.en: Shirmo was born in 1960.  She lives and works in the South part of Tajikistan. She likes her country very much because nature in her region is so wonderful. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a rent worker. He has a small income. Shirmo has her own business. She has runs her business successfully for five years. Shirmo sews women’s clothes and also knits children’s clothes. Shirmo knows her job well and she likes it. She is going to organize an additional business with animal husbandry because she needs to earn more money. She is asking for 1000 Somoni to buy sheep for the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep for organizing new business

loans.name: Susana Zoila

texts.es:
La socia Susana se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz.azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Susana, a member of the group, is still working in her grocery store. She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has run her store business for 7 years, and it is going really well. Her dream is to expand her shop business. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to meeting the established repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz vive en la hermosa  ciudad del Cusco ubicado al sur de Perú.  Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo muñecas, guantes, gorros y entre otros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chalinas y chompas para la temperada de frio. 

Mary Luz se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad y agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Mary Luz se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad y agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.

Mary Luz lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, located in southern Perú.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who is getting her family ahead through her efforts and her dedication to her job.  Her main line of work is artisan craft sales, such as dolls, gloves, knitted hats, and other items.  She has belonged to the “Cusco” communal bank for a number of years.  At this point she needs a loan to buy scarves and sweaters for the cold season.

Mary Luz is happy because of this loan, and is committed to making her payments in a responsible manner, on time.  She is thankful to all the investors for this loan and hopes they keep supporting other project.

loans.use: to buy scarves and sweaters

loans.name: Henri

texts.fr:
Henri est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 30 ans, marié et père de 02 enfants âgés de 03 et 07 ans. il convient de préciser que ce dernier va déjà à l'école.
Henri a en plus à charge 02 autres personnes qui vont également à l'école. Comme activité, il gère un centre d'appel téléphonique communément appelé "call box" depuis 04 ans déjà. ceci dit il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permit de constituer un portefeuille clientèle considérable et fidèle. 
il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter en gros les crédits de communication pour éviter des ruptures afin de pouvoir  satisfaire sa clientèle à tout moment. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Henri is a young many from Cameroon, 30 years old, married, and a father of two children, who are three and seven years old. It should be noted that both his children are going to school.

Henri also has two other people under his care, who also go to school.

For a living, Henri has been running a call center called "Call Box" for the past four years. He does well in this business, and he has a considerable number of loyal customers.

Henri would like a loan to buy phone credits at wholesale, so that he can avoid gaps in his stock and better satisfy his customers all the time. 

Earnings will allow him to better support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy phone credits

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is 45 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has four children, and is the only one responsible for managing his household. Imtiaz is a carpenter by trade and has been running his carpentry business for many years.

Imtiaz wants to expand his business to fulfill the demands of his customers. To do this, he needs to buy different types of merchandise including pieces of wood in bulk, cutter blades and needles, as well as other relevant tools and accessories. Due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy these items. Therefore, he has requested a Kiva S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to expand his business and help him buy relevant merchandise.

Imtiaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy wood, cutter blades and needles to expand his carpentry business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cigarros y champus,ella lleva a diferentes lugares,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cigarros y champus.La socia solicita el credito para comprar champus y cigarros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Francisca continues to work selling cigars and “champus” [a warm drink made with corn and fruit]; she takes these to a variety of places.  Through this business she wants to get ahead; her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her cigars and champus.  She needs this loan to buy champus and cigars.

Francisca is happy because of this loan and is committed to completing her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy "champus" and cigars.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Ahmad, along with his eldest child, provides the family’s monthly income while the other two children continue their studies. Ahmad owns a small shop where he sells plate glass, which is used for the installation of display windows. He not only sells these glass sheets, but also specializes in their installation. These glass sheets are highly demanded in the area. Ahmad has been in this field since 2007 and now he has a hired employee. His business has grown rapidly, because he is famous for this work and he has a lot of experience. Ahmad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter to protect his shop, to install a sign and to renovate his shop. With help from this loan, Ahmad aims to improve his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and sign and renovate his shop

loans.name: Serges

texts.fr:
Serges est un jeune homme de 27 ans marié. Père d'un enfant de plus d'un an, il vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Il detient une boutique dans un coin de la place où il exerce depuis 03 ans et vend divers accéssoires tesl que: les téléphones prtables, les chargeurs, les ceintures, les sacs de classe et bien d'autres. Grace a son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine il s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'il aimerait continuer de satisfaire. pour cela il sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra dacheter (les téléphones, les chargeurs, les chauffes-eaux, les torches, les multiprises et les radios de poche).
Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêr lui permettront d'augmenter son capital, d'agrandir sa boutique et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Serges is a young man, 27 years old, and married, and lives in an area around the capital. He is a father one child, who is over a year old. 

Serges owns a shop, which he has had for three years, and sells various goods: mobile phones, chargers, belts, school bags, etc. Thanks to his energy and his competence in this area, he has a growing number of customers who he would like to continue to satisfy. 

For this, he is seeking a loan which will allow him to buy phones, chargers, water heaters, flash lights, power strips, and pocket radios. Earnings from this loan will allow him to increase his capital, expand his shop, and to better support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy telephones, chargers, water heaters, etc

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 21-year-old single man, who has been working as an electrician for nine years. Abbass was only 12 years old when he started working to help his parents with their income, since they couldn't afford to pay for his education and living needs.

In 2010, he established his own services business and he is still working hard on developing it as much as he can. That's why he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary tools and needs requested to finish a house he is working on.

Abbass is an ambitious person who puts very much effort into developing his business to cover his beloved family's needs and requests.

loans.use: To buy tools to finish a house he is working on

loans.name: Poshokhon

texts.en:
Poshokhon is a smart woman. She is married and has four children. Poshokhon is always looking out for the well-being of her family. She has a musical education, and knows music well. 

She is going to start a business organizing music lessons for local people, and will rent a place to give paid music lessons. Poshokhon took a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy musical instruments for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments to start a new business teaching music lessons.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, age 31, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a chain maker. He makes chains himself and sells them in the market. 

Sakina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to buy iron wire coil for making chains. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Sakina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron wire coil for making chains to sell.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica,  esta soltero solo vive con su papá quien depende en su totalidad de él porque tiene 89 años de edad.

Carlos se desempeña como mecánico, desde que ya pudo tener conocimiento de la elaboración de piezas de maquinaria pesada se ha dedicado a este quehacer, pues su papá le heredo un torno y piezas que utiliza para su desempeño y además le heredo su conocimiento del  trabajo, el trabajo lo realiza en su casa durante todo el día aprovechando que ahí tiene el taller. 


Carlos el dinero solicitado a CEDICAMPO, lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de unas máquinas desgranadoras con motor eléctrico, ya que a realizado unas cinco y tiene demanda  y en ese momento esta satisfaciendo su necesidad de trabajar.


Su sueño es ser productor de este tipo de equipos agrícolas, para que de esa manera también apoyar a los agricultores que necesitan modernizarse, y la única manera es plantearse un nuevo modelo de trabajo,  pero la única manera de lograrlo es hacer buen uso de recursos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old. He studied through 6th grade basic education. He is single and lives with his father who depends entirely on him because he is 89 years old.

Carlos works as a mechanic, since he was already aware of the development of pieces of heavy machinery. He has been dedicated to this task as his father inherited a lathe and used parts for their performance and also inherited his knowledge of the job. He works at home all day to take advantage of his workshop there.

Carlos asked CEDICAMPO money will be invested in the purchase of raw material for the productions of shelling machines with electric motor, as he know has about five and is in demand and at this moment he is this satisfying his need to work.

Her dream is to be a producer of this type of agricultural equipment, so that way he can also support farmers that also need to update, and the only way is to consider a new model of work. But the only way to accomplish that is to have a good use of resources.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the production of shelling machines with electric motor.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como papa,trigo y cebada,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papa,trigo y cebada.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Georgina continues working at her business selling dry grains such as wheat, barley and potatoes. She works from 8am until 6pm. Georgina has had this business for a number of years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her business. Georgina is applying for this loan in order to buy potatoes, wheat and barley.

Georgina feels grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, barley and wheat.

loans.name: José  Regulo

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a José en su negocio de venta de ropa y aceite, jabón, pastas, jabones y artículos para el hogar, pues con este impulso ha logrado generar ingresos y bajar su endeudamiento informal, porque con más inventarios su clientela se ha incrementado.    José da las gracias a sus financiadores de Kiva y pide que lo sigan apoyando, para ver cristalizados sus sueños como el de tener un almacén en un punto comercial.  En la actualidad  él, está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa y otros artículos como  víveres arroz, pastas ropa etc. Una vez mas espera tener mas inventarios para seguir impactando a su clientela y así su credikiva sería muy exitoso.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting José with his business selling clothes, oil, soap, pastas and items for the home. With this support he has been able to generate an income and pay off some of his debts. With more stock he consequently has more customers. José thanks Kiva lenders and asks that they continue to support him so that he can realise his dreams, such as of having a large store in a shopping centre. José is currently applying for a new Kiva loan. He will use it to buy clothes and other items including supplies such as rice and pastas. Once again, José hopes to have more stock on order to continue impressing his customers and for his Kiva loan to be very successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other items including supplies such as rice and pastas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 43 years old and she manages an eatery business to make a living. She believes that with hard work and strong determination in life she will achieve a better way of living and earn a better income. According to her, she has been running this business for 16 years. She can say that through this business, her family situation has improved. Jane is now requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients to cook food such as meat and vegetables as well as soft drinks. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook food such as meat and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Veronica se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es amplair el negocio de venta de productos naturales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica continues to manage her business of selling natural products. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Veronica has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her natural products business.

Veronica is requesting a loan in order to buy natural products. She is pleased with the loan and promises to submit her payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Violeta de 35 años de edad  separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella pertenece al grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” conformado por 08 socios responsables. Violeta se dedica  a la venta de productos naturales  gracias a su constante dedicación logró salir adelante, Ella sola educa a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del  padre. Su mayor anhelo es de poder instalar un espacio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos naturales. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de productos naturales como miel de abeja, jalea real y tónicos. El grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Violeta es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste polo celeste manga larga, lleva puesto una bolsa crema.
texts.en: Violeta is 35 years old, separated, and has 2 children who are dependent on her. She belongs to the group Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women), which is comprised of 8 responsible members. Violeta works selling natural products and, thanks to her constant dedication, she has achieved success. She is raising her children alone as she does not have support from their father. Her greatest desire is to have a place where she can sell her products. She is requesting this loan to buy natural products such as honey, royal jelly, and tonics. The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Violeta is the second on the left in the photo, wearing the blue shirt with long sleeves and a cream bag.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more glass.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother, 48 years old. She has two children who are still in school. She runs a grocery store and has been in this business for 19 years. She gets monthly income of KES 20,000 (shillings).

This will be Jane's seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to pay for school fees. In the future, she wants to build rental houses.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 29 years of age, who is single and lives with his four brothers. Abbas and three of his brothers share the family income together.

Abbas owns a shop where he sells household goods, like plastic cups, mugs, plates, and vases. He established his business in 2009 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has a hired employee and he has been well-known in his surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Abbas is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000 in order to install a rolling shutter and signage for his shop, as well as to install some new shelves on the walls of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may provide himself a bright future, with a stable career path.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and signage for his shop, as well as to install some new shelves on the walls of his shop.

loans.name: Luis Jaime

texts.es: Luis tiene 22 años de edad. Es originario de la ciudad de León.  Es un joven casado, y estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Con esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo de sus padres ha logrado salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para pagar los módulos de culminación de estudios.  Su plan futuro es desempeñarse como profesional en una empresa de prestigio.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old and originally from the city of León. He is a married young man who is studying at one of the universities in the city. With effort, dedication, and the support of his parents, Luis has been able to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan so that he can pay for the courses needed to finish his degree. His future plans include working as a professional for a prestigious company.

loans.use: to pay for the courses needed to finish his degree.

loans.name: Zufnun

texts.ru: Зуфнун мастерица по пошиву женских платьев. Ей 30 лет. Она разведена и живет одна с двумя дочерьми в районе Дангара. Ее дочерям по 6 и 4 года. Они для нее смысл жизни. Зуфнун одна воспитывает своих дочерей и чтобы обеспечивать их она занимается у себя дома шитьем. Зуфнун на протяжении 4 лет принимает заказы на шитье женских национальных платьев. Ей нравится швейное дело. Она получает удовольствие от самого процесса работы. Чтобы расширить свое дело Зуфнун просит кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки и тканей. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку. Благодаря новой машинке Зуфнун сможет шить быстрее и качественнее, что увеличит доходность ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Zufnun is a seamstress that makes women's dresses. She is 30 years old. She is divorced and lives alone with her two daughters in the Dangara region. Her daughters are four and six years old.  They are the center of her life.  Since Zufnun is raising her ​​daughters by herself, she sews at home in order to provide for them.  For four years, Zufnun has been taking orders for sewing women's national dresses.  She likes sewing and enjoys the process of work.  

To grow her business, Zufnun has applied for a loan to purchase fabric and a new sewing machine.  She is hopeful about receiving financial support. With the new sewing machine, she  will be able to sew faster and better, which will increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old, married father of one child. For the last ten years, he has been employed in the agriculture sector and with a food production company. 

Khaled wants to develop his family's living and start his own career. That's why he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy a car that will help him start his own agriculture business and to move easily from one land to another. He will invest part of the loan to cover the expenses of his expected baby.

Khaled hopes to start his own business properly and to succeed in it, to make sure that he can plan for a brighter future for his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help him start his own agriculture business and to move easily from one land to another.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree course.

loans.name: Ziobkhon

texts.en:
Ziobkhon was born in 1955. She is widowed and has 4 children who are all adults. 15 years ago, Ziobkhon began her own business. She sells industry goods such as cosmetics, mirrors, threads and needles, etc. She has a selling place in a local market. Experience has helped her to develop the business. 

She is a repeat client of IMON, with a good credit history. She used her previous loans for increasing the working capital of her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cosmetics and threads, etc. to sell and thus increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and threads, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria  vive en la ciudad del cusco ubicado al sur de Perú. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, papas, tomates, apios, zanahorias, maíz y entre otros, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras.

Victoria  se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Victoria lives in the city of Cusco, which is located in southern Peru. She is an enterprising woman who is able to move her family forward because of the effort and dedication to her work. Her primary business is selling vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, celery, carrots, corn, and other produce. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Cusco” for several years and is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more vegetables.

Victoria is pleased with the loan and promises to submit her payments on time and handle them with great responsibility. She is grateful to all of the lenders on this loan and hopes that they will continue supporting other projects.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
This is Marife. She is a 41-year-old resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ananias, a tricycle driver, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Marife sells different products for retail such as dishwashing liquid, fabric conditioner, powder detergent, and other products. She gets her products from a supplier who gives it to her at a lower price. She then sells the products to customers with a little income. She also sells plasticwares such as drawer cabinets and dish drawers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies such as fabric softener, dishwashing liquids, detergent powder, and other products needed in her business.

Marife dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies such as fabric softener, dishwashing liquids, detergent powder, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Evenecer, está conformada por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familia con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es  Marisol y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, sal, jugos, fósforos, huevos, crema, queso, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias  ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Evenecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Evenecer communal association is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, who are mothers and fathers with fifteen children under their responsibility. They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country. They are hard working and responsible with a drive for personal improvement. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources, they were not able to complete their educations and have had to work to contribute to their household expenses.  

Thanks to her efforts and desire to improve her life, Marisol is the coordinator. For a living, she runs a convenience store. It's a little store that sells food items in small amounts, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, salt, juices, eggs, mayonnaise, cheese, and soft drinks. The store also sells things like detergents and matches. She spends about 12 hours every day running her business and selling her products. The object of this loan is to make an investment and stock her store with food items so that she can increase her sales in the not too distant future. Evenecer is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders have given to people of scare resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they have a means of working with dignity.

loans.use: to stock her store with food items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, salt, juices, eggs, mayonnaise, cheese, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana vive en la ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú y continúa dedicándose a la venta de ceviche de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como  por ejemplo limón, sal, pescado fresco, camotes, maíz y otras cosas más. 

Eliana se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Eliana lives in the city of Cusco in the southern part of Peru and continues as a street vendor selling ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon juice). She has been doing this for a number of years and it has been going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who belongs to the communal bank, "Imasumac II". 

She needs a loan at this time so she can buy supplies such as lemons, salt, fresh fish, sweet potatoes, corn, and other things. 

Eliana is grateful for the loan and promises to make her scheduled repayments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fish, lemons, and more.

loans.name: Shiala

texts.en:
Shiala is a 34-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband and five children. Her husband is working as a cook in a restaurant.

Shiala has requested a loan from Kiva Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's restaurant. He will be using this amount to purchase a variety of food items such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, ice cream, milk, and spices. As a result, her husband will be able to provide a greater variety of services to his clients and increase his net income and savings. 

Shiala wants to live a good and simple life with her family. She wishes to renovate her house, to provide quality education to all of her children, and to fulfill all of the other basic needs of her family. She prays a lot for a better future for her children and her husband's good health. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food items such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, ice cream, milk, and spices.

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
Sardaran, age 60, is the mother of seven children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Sardaran, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount. Sardaran is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad del Cusco al Sur del Perú y continúa dedicándose a la venta de joyas como por ejemplo aretes, pulseras, anillos y entre otros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que pertenece al banco comunal “Imasumac II” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo como por ejemplo alambres, perlas, plata y oro. 

Maria se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru and still works selling jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, rings, and more. She has been working in this business for several years already and she is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who belongs to the communal bank “Imasumac II” and at this time she needs a loan to buy supplies such as wire, pearls, silver, and gold.

Maria is grateful for the loan and promises to responsibly comply with the established loan payments.

loans.use: to buy work supplies such as wire, pearls, silver, and gold

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 33 years old and lives in the village of Aghavnavank in the Tavush region. Arnold is married and lives with his nice wife and pretty children (two daughters and a son). For five years he has constantly gone to the Russian Federation for work abroad, which enlarges his family income. 

Still, the main income for his young family comes from the farming and gardening in which this couple is engaged. On his farm Arnold has four cows, a calf and a large plot of land. He sells milk, meat, apples, nuts and figs through the re-sellers. Arnold is asking for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a calf and animal fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf and animal fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina was born in 1983. She is not married. Zarina lives with her parents. She works at IMON. Also she is a student in her fourth course at the Agrarian Tajikistan University. She studies in the faculty of Finance and Credit. Zarina studies well and she is very smart. She manages well with her university studies and with her work. 

Now she must pay her tuition. She is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es:
Martha, a sus 47 años  de edad, es una mujer luchadora, perseverante y servicial, madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que tuvo que afrontar la dolorosa muerte de su esposo, por lo que toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella. Esto la motivó para iniciar su propio negocio, una sala de internet en la que también presta servicio de fotocopias, escáner, venta de productos de catálogo y comidas rápidas que ella misma prepara, como pasteles de pollo, empanadas y palitos de queso; de esta forma se gana la vida y logra dar educación, techo y alimentación a sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito como un refuerzo de su capital de trabajo, con el que podrá comprar mercancía (accesorios, cremas corporales, cosméticos) e insumos al por mayor (verduras, pollo, palitos de queso, gaseosas), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y así satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, logrando aumentar las ventas e ingresos para la familia.
Martha manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un local con una mejor ubicación y cada vez fortalecer su negocio con mayor variedad de artículos para así fidelizar sus clientes, esto le dará paso para aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio y podrá continuar velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y podrá darles una mejor educación para que se conviertan en hombres íntegros con un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old. She is a hardworking mother and is perseverant and helpful. She is a mother of two boys and also head of her household since having to confront the painful death of her husband, when responsibility for providing for her family fell to her. This was her motivation for starting her own business, an internet cafe where she also provides photocopy and scanning services, catalog sales, and fast foods that she herself prepares, such as  chicken pastries, empanadas, and cheese sticks. In this way she earns a living and provides education, housing, and food for her children. 

She is currently requesting the loan to supplement her working capital. She will use it to buy merchandise (accessories, body lotions, cosmetics) and ingredients at wholesale price (vegetables, chicken, cheese sticks, soft drinks). This will allow her to have a greater variety of products to offer and to satisfy the needs of her costumers, so she can increase her sales and income for her family. 

Martha explains that her greatest wish is to have a store with a better location and to strengthen her business with a better variety of items so she can gain her customer's loyalty. This will allow her to increase the profitability of her business and to continue providing for the wellbeing of her children and give them a better education so they can become good men and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (accessories, body lotions, cosmetics) and ingredients at wholesale price (vegetables, chicken, cheese sticks, soft drinks).

loans.name: Murotaly

texts.en:
Murotaly was born in year 1969. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. She has been busy with up-bringing her children. Murotaly has been busy with growing potatoes, wheat, rice, etc. for more than 10 years. Murotaly has an additional income from animal husbandry. He feeds two cows and four sheep. 

Murotaly has a good reputation among the local people. He sells his harvest at a local market. He is going to make a new sowing but he does not have money. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. 

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of expenses, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Nasreen, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the fields and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the fields and sell them in the market at a profitable price.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 28 years old from the municipality of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages three and six. For 10 years now, she has been buying and selling shells and sea cucumbers. 

She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy shells and sea cucumbers for more profit. Marilou is optimistic that with her hard work, she can change the life of her family.

In the future, she hopes to provide her children with good education.

loans.use: to buy shells and sea cucumbers.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, age 34, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Fozia, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. 

Fozia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Frido

texts.en:
Frido is 47 years old, and he lives in Yerevan. He has a large family. He is the father of three children. His oldest daughter is a student, and his two other children are also school-age.
