Frido has no higher education. For several years, he worked as a mechanic. His wife does not work, but she helps Frido in his beekeeping activities. He has 10 beehives. He manages to sell only a very small amount of honey. Frido also sells hay as animal food, which he gathers from his plot of land. The fact that he lives in a rather crowded city and not in village life conditions, does not impede Frido from becoming a farmer and establishing a farm of his own, with the hope of having some income for his big family.

Frido requests a loan of 550,000 AMD to buy four calves. Near his house, he has a barn built of his own, where he plans to keep his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy four calves.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 21-year-old single man who has been working in car body repair and painting in addition to performing the necessary maintenance to the motorcycles and selling spare parts for five years now.

At the beginning Abbass faced few problems establishing his business, especially given that he had a small amount of capital which he invested to start his business. He had few obstacles at the beginning to merge with the market.

Abbass also traveled abroad to improve his standard of living, but unfortunately he had no chance , that's why he came back home to develop his own established business and work on improving it.

Today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special motorcycle spare parts and necessary maintenance equipment that is newly released.

He is very anxious about this loan and he is looking forward to developing his business widely, hoping to start selling motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special motorcycle spare parts and necessary new maintenance equipment

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.en: Nuridin is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in a rural area. Nuridin has been busy with growing wheat and potatoes more than 10 years. He has a great experience. He works on his own land. Nuridin is the main supplier of income for his family. He has a tractor which he uses for land work. Nuridin has additional income from animal husbandry. Nuridin uses his income to cover family costs. He is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and to repair his tractor. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and to repair his tractor

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, who works in preparing and selling special perfume scents at his house fo the last fifteen months. He is also employed in a security company to improve his living and increase his income. 
Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to complete necessary maintenance to his car and sell it to start trading cars as an additional income business.
Ali is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in his domain. He will work hard to develop his own businesses through opening a wide perfume production and selling shop and in addition to develop his car selling business so he can stop being employed in a security company and focus on his own established businesses.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his car and sell it to start trading cars as an additional income business

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: “JULIO C. TELLO AL PROGRESO” es uno de los grupos que se encuentra conformada por socias responsables y dedicadas al comercio minorista. Rachela tiene 59 años es conviviente con hijos todos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas frutas gaseosas en las afueras de su vivienda en quiosco. En horas de la tarde presta servicios de limpieza y cocina. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas gaseosas y frutas. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Rachela es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “Julio C. Tello al Progreso” group is made up of responsible members dedicated to the retailing business. 

Rachela is 59 years old, has a life-partner, and adult children. She works selling candy, fruit, and sodas from a kiosk outside her home. In the afternoon she offers the services of cleaning and cooking. She will invest the loan buying candy, sodas, and fruit. In the group she serves as president. 

The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the provided loan. Rachela is the second person from the right side.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, candy, and sodas

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en: Musarrat is a 44-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years. She has two buffalo and one cow for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life, a good education, and food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through Kashf Foundation’s support. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo, which will allow her to inflate her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 55 years old from the community of Tagbilaran, Bohol. For two years now she has operated a Sari-sari store business (general store) selling basic household needs like seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, shampoo, bath soap and chips. She is asking for a loan 4000 PHP to buy noodles, soy sauce, cooking oil, detergent, canned goods and sugar. Rosario hope that she will be a successful businesswoman someday.  

Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soy sauce, cooking oil, detergent, canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita previously received a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quality golf balls to sell. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her family’s personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quality golf balls to sell. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pacita hopes her business will be more flourishing and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members who meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quality golf balls to sell.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 46-year-old married woman, and a mother to five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that their family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. He currently needs additional capital to grow the business. 

To meet that need, Azra is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy clothes to resell, so that he can respond more quickly to customer needs. He is planning to put a side some savings from the increased profits to pay for electricity and gas bills. Azra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en:
Ruksana is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of four children. For the past 10 years, she has been successfully running a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and sells them out close to the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). Her husband also helps her sell animals in the local market.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase five more baby goats. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase five more baby goats.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 6th loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow.  Razia is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 53 year old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with pack of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a diligent woman. She is a wife of a rickshaw driver. He works day and night so that he can earn enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He wants to provide quality education and a bright future for his children.
 
Currently, the engine of his rickshaw had stopped working. Due to this, he is unable to continue his work. He is facing many financial issues because of this as he is unable to pay monthly bills, school fees for his children, or fulfill the daily basic needs.

Shamim wants to help her husband, therefore, as a member of two persons lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This is going to help her husband continue generating income. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Shamim raises her hand.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier   TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  fruits et  légumes à l’image de  SETOU qui est la 3ème femme debout   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 kg d’oignons, 100 kg de patates 50 kg de pommes de terre et des régimes de bananes plantain avec les grossistes de Sikasso. 
Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Danaya group is composed of six married women averaging 42 years of age, with six children. They live in traditional extended families in the Torakabougou district in the town of Bougouni. They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. In order to bolster their financing capacity so as to better manage their business, the group members have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their first loan. This group of women sells fruits and vegetables, which is what Setou does, for example. Setou is the third one standing from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 150 kg [331 lbs] of onions, 100 kg [220 lbs] of sweet potatoes, 50 kg [110 lbs] of potatoes as well as some banana bunches from wholesalers in Sikasso. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, mainly to female customers. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en: Tanveer is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows well the techniques of stitching and has become famous for providing beautiful dresses in her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 40000 to buy a stock of thread and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces in different colors to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to pay with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads and packs of zippers, buttons, and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 34 years old, and is single but he expects to marry this year. He supports two children in his family, and he runs a clothing business in Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the last five years, and he makes a monthly income of 28,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Musa has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000, which he will use to buy school uniforms and clothing material for resale. With the profits that he hopes to make, he will pay for his siblings' school fees, and buy more stock for his business.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and clothing material for resale

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling milk for many years. At the present, she has one buffalo and two cows for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She is the mother of six children, and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food, and clothing. 

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. For about three years, she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. 

In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Zainab is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (lingerie and baby clothes) and to make some alterations to her store.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives in Tsovagyugh village in Gegharkunik region. Suren is a good farmer and a very responsible client of Nor Horizon and Kiva. He hopes to receive his second Kiva loan. The first loan he used for the purchase of animal fodder, and he paid off his loan fluently in accordance with his repayment schedule. 

Suren continues his farming activities, and he perfectly takes care of his farm livestock (cows, sheep, pigs and chickens). He is also perfect in agricultural activities, and he cultivates on his land potatoes, greens and tomatoes, which his family uses. He also sells the produce to resellers.

Suren asks for his second Kiva loan in an amount of 1,100,000 Armenian drams since he again wants to buy animal fodder, which every time turns out to be not enough for the season, as he plans and buys beforehand.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is a 24-year-old married woman who has had a business selling milk with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Tasleem’s husband. The business has great potential for growth and Tasleem is actively helping her husband. She has five calves, four cows and five buffaloes for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation.  She is happily running her business with support of it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to have an increase in the production capacity of the milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. At present she has one buffalo and two calves. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Maa Dangardei Shg Group

texts.en:
Kanak, the lady standing with her hand raised in the photograph, is a lady who is 26 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India.

She is engaged in the production and sale of vegetables, which she carries out in the community where she lives. She learned this occupation from her parents, who had been engaged in it for many years. This work generates the income that she needs to support her family, and she comments that she likes this occupation because it is honest, and it helps her to feel useful to her community. She has more than seven years of experience in this occupation.

She decided to organize a group with her friends, with the goal of helping each other and thus improving their living standards. She will use the loan for the purchase of supplies, such as fertilizer, and for the payment of workers, in order to maintain the vegetable plants. 

Kanak dreams of increasing the area of her vegetable fields, and thus increasing her income, in order to provide her children with an academic preparation and prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es casada  tiene 55 años y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez  la socia se dedica a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, agricultura, ganadería, venta de trigos y maíz, panadería.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan communal bank.  This bank is located in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Juana, a member, is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising small animals like guinea pigs, among others.  She raises these animals in order to later sell them to the customers who request them.  

She also devotes herself to agriculture.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  This is the way that the member gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members devote themselves to the business of selling animals, agriculture, livestock, selling wheat and corn, and the bakery business.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Zulhaydar

texts.en: Zulhaydar is 41-years-old. He is married and has five children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the northern part of Tajikistan. Zulhaydar began his own business with growing potatoes and wheat 15 years ago. He has his own land. Zulhaydar’s daughter and wife help him with managing the business. He has additional income from animal husbandry. He has difficulty covering his family's costs because his family is big. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seed for the new sowing season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seed for the new sowing season

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 55-year-old married woman. She deals in a business of selling embroidered cloths in her community. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and, after doing embroidery, sells to the people of her locality. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Rehana is requesting a loan 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors, along with packs of threads and sequins in various colors. It will help her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors, along with packs of threads and sequins in various colors.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 57-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. The man shown in the photo is her son, who helps her in the business. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Zahida makes enough revenue to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), which she will use to buy rice, sugar, cold drinks, biscuits and flour in bulk from a wholesale market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Zahida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cold drinks, biscuits and flour in bulk

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz, age 37, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a restaurant in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of food items to cook and sell.  However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult.  Because of that his wife, as a member of a three person lending group, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase a variety of food items like sugar, vegetables, chicken and rice. Mumtaz is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Mumtaz raises her hand as a group leader.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase a variety of food items like sugar, vegetables, chicken and rice

loans.name: Frrok

texts.en:
Frrok, a poor villager from northern Albania, lives with his two children, ages 20 and 18, along with his wife in the house seen in the photograph.  He needs your financial help and compassion immediately.  He has borrowed some olive seedlings to start a nursery garden, yet he has not paid the money and that is why he is requesting this loan. 

He farms for others, his wife works in a fishery and his oldest child works in construction, but their incomes are still very small.  Frrok is going to plant these seedlings in the village of Shkodra where the soil is very supportive and the climate is favorable for this type of tree.  "I wanted to consider this as a little business; in 2-3 years these olive trees will have some fruits for harvesting.  I can pickle the olives and make olive oil from them in the beginning for my family's use and later on to sell," said Frrok to the interviewing staff.

loans.use: to pay for olive seedlings to plant

loans.name: Biswa Jaganath Shg Group

texts.en:
Tarabati (shown in the photo standing with hand raised) is a 53-year-old woman who is married and has two children; both her children are married. She lives in a small village of Odisha, India. 

Tarabati produces and sells vegetables in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Tarabati’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Tarabati has more than 17 years of experience in this trade. 

She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. Tarabati will use her loan to buy supplies (such as fertilizer) and to pay for labor so that she can maintain her vegetable plants. She dreams of increasing her vegetable cultivation so that she can improve her income.

Note: One woman in the photo is not part of this group loan. It is the woman who is just visible, standing behind the lady, fourth from right, in a red sari.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay labor charges for her cropland.

loans.name: Jagannath Shg Group

texts.en:
Bhanumati belongs to a small village in the Koraput district, which is located in the forest area of Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Bhanumati.

She is 30 years old and alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture. She has been in business for years and things have gone well for her because of the hard work she does. Bhanumati is responsible and persevering and sells her goods to customers who request them. Her aim is to continue working to get ahead.

Bhanumati is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

All the members of this "Jagannath Shg" group are women. The other members are involved in the sale of vegetables, food and drink, agricultural services, fruit and vegetable cultivation, and raising small animals.

Bhanumati is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Nazareth, está conformada por ocho integrantes dos hombres y seis mujeres, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan para brindarle un futuro mejor  sus hijos y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Ruth y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jugos, huevos, detergente,  gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nazareth  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Nazareth communal association is made up of eight members, two gentlemen and six ladies, responsible mothers and fathers with 20 children to care for.  They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the western part of the country, and they are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately, they were not able to study for careers because of limited financial resources and they had to go to work at a young age.  They work to provide a future and better opportunities for their children.

Ruth is the group’s coordinator and thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a small store where she sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, juices, eggs, detergents, and matches in small quantities.  She works about 12 hours daily and her business is set up in her home.  Her goal for the money from this loan is to buy food products to stock her store so that she can have a better income in the near future.  Nazareth is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people from poor countries like Nicaragua to have better means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Meerabai Shg Group

texts.en:
Phulamati, aged about 24 years, is the group leader for the 10 members of the group "MEERABAI SHG" of Koraput district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of four members, herself, her husband and two children. The member standing with hand raised is Phulamati. 

She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a grocery cum general store in her village with the support of her husband for the last six years.

Phulamati, along with the other nine members from her village, formed a group and it is the first time they will take out a loan from People's Forum for development of their existing businesses. At present her family income is about Rs. 5,000 per month which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan. From the loan she will purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, etc, as general household items for resale. She has a dream: to build a house for her family.

She is excited to have this loan and she is very thankful to KIVA for this support.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits and sugar, etc, for resale

loans.name: Beena's Group

texts.en:
Beena is a leader of this three person lending group. She is a 42-year-old housewife and a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband owns a plastic goods shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He manufactures plastic products with a molding machine and then sells them at a good price.

Presently he needs to purchase raw material for crushing to manufacture plastic goods to sell, including plastic bottles, cans, plastic toys, etc. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Beena, as a member of a three person lending group, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the things needed with the help of the loan amount. Beena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Beena is raising her hand.

loans.use: To help her husband buy plastic raw material that he can crush to manufacture plastic accessories.

loans.name: Yeghnik

texts.en:
Yeghnik is from Margara village of the Armavir region. He is a constructor by profession and works as a seasonal migrant worker in a neighboring country. During the months when Yeghnik is in Armenia, he runs a farm. The farm includes 15 turkeys and 2 calves. He also owns a greenhouse where tomatoes and peppers are grown. 

Yeghnik lives with his mother and brother. His mother is a teacher at the local village school and his brother serves in the army. Yeghnik works hard to successfully run the farm to ensure a stable income from it.  Now, he asks for  this loan of USD 2,000 to be able to purchase an ox and renovate his greenhouse. 

As this is Yeghnik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who do not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for an ox and renovate his greenhouse

loans.name: G. Sai Shg Group

texts.en:
This group, called "G. Sai Shg", consists of nine ladies who live in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha, India. The group has applied for a loan of 135,000 INR from People's Forum (Kiva's Partner). All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, vegetable selling, milk selling etc. 

Pratima, a 26-year-old married mother with two children, has been working as a vendor selling fish and other foods such as items made of milk. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise her children well. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish and other food (milk). 

Pratima hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. She, along with her group members, are very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and milk for her food business.

loans.name: Pucaray De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margot ella es soltera y tiene 26 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de papa, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE communal bank, located in the Pisac district, within the Cusco department and province.

Margot is 26 years old and has her own business where she prepares and sells various dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups, and meat dishes.  She works from 10:00 pm to 5:00 pm, has had this business for seven years and things are going very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

The other members sell clothing, farm, sell groceries, and sell prepared food.

[Margot] is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this method and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 39-year-old housewife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit and vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges, onions, tomatoes, chilies etc in his shop. Presently, he is interested tin offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Sumera has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sumera is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 47, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Nazreen, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. 

Nazreen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años es soltera. Ella implemento su bazar librería hace 07 meses y a la vez vende productos de belleza a través de catálogos. Años atrás prestaba servicios de secretaria. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cuadernos fólderes lapiceros lápiz temperas  por campaña escolar. En el grupo “ESPERANZA Y AMOR “cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brincado. Maria es la que se encuentra sentada en el lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and single.  She started her bookstore at the market seven months ago.  She also sells beauty products by catalog.  Years ago, she worked as a secretary.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase notebooks, folders, pens, pencils, and tempera paint for the school year.  

In the Esperanza and Amor group, she serves as the secretary.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.  

Maria is seated on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, folders, pens, pencils, and tempera paint for the school year.

loans.name: Lourdes Esthela

texts.es:
La Señora. Lourdes se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Mas que Vencedoras y este es su tercer crédito, vive en ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que goza de una estructura inclinada por su geografía, su gente es amable, gentil y luchadora, lo más enigmático es su iglesia que se encuentra en lo más alto de la ciudad.
La Señora Lourdes tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos de y 2 años y su último hijo de apenas de 2 meses, su esposo es sastre, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Lourdes labora en su negocio propio y a lado de su esposo, se dedican a confeccionar ropa deportiva y otras prendas, actividad que aprendió trabajando y labora de lunes a sábados. Su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de telas e hilos. Su sueño es de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the communal bank "Mas que Vencedoras," and this is her third loan.  She lives in the city of Azogues, a city that, due to its geography, sits astride a slope.  Here the people are kind, gentle, and tenacious.  The most intriguing aspect of the town is its church, which is located at one of the highest points of the city.

Lourdes, 28, is married and has 2 children aged 2 and 2 months.  Her husband is a tailor.  They don't own a home, so they live in a rented dwelling.  

Lourdes works in her own business alongside her husband.  She makes sports clothes and other garments, a trade that she learned on the job.  She works Mondays through Saturdays.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of fabric and threads.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 24 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera y desde temprana edad trabaja y estudia. Actualmente, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Beatriz Elena cuenta con muy pocos recursos económicos lo que la ha motivado siempre a esforzarse para salir adelante, todos sus proyectos los ha realizados y se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hoy en día. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título cumpliendo su sueño más deseado en la vida. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Beatriz is 24 years old and from Leon.  She is a single young woman who has been working and studying from an early age.  She currently attends one of the universities in the city.  Beatriz Elena has few financial resources, which has motivated her to work to get ahead.  She has completed all her plans and is proud for what she has accomplished to date.  She is asking for this loan to pay for her study modules so she can finish her degree, which is her greatest life’s desire.  Her plans for the future are to find employment where she can expand her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is 29 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has one child and he is the only one responsible for managing his household. Faisal is a carpenter by profession and he has been running his carpentry business for many years. He wants to expand his business to fulfill the demands of his customers. For this purpose, he needs to buy different types of merchandise such as pieces of wood in bulk, cutter blades, needles and other relevant tools and accessories. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy this merchandise.

Therefore, he has requested a Kiva S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to expand the size of his business and help him to buy the relevant merchandise he needs. 

Faisal is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood, blades, needles and other tools

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Ms. Rubina is 39 years old and married. She has been selling crockery for eight years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling the crockery to people of their community and in local market. She makes enough income to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 60,000. In this way, she will be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting an improvement in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crockery to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven emprendedora y activa, con un espíritu de superación que la ha impulsado a buscar alternativas para salir adelante. Por falta de oportunidades laborales, comenzó a prestar el servicio de manicure y pedicure a domicilio, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica y, que le ha permitido generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar, pues ya cuenta con buena clientela, principalmente de sus amigos y familiares.
Con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, ella desea seguir prestando sus servicios desde su residencia, pues piensa montar una sala de belleza, por ello solicita el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una silla de peluquería, herramientas e insumos de trabajo (tijeras, plancha, secador, esmaltes, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Carolina es consciente que se enfrenta a un desafío grande, pues debe acreditar el negocio en un punto fijo, por ello trabajará con entusiasmo, perseverancia y dedicación para lograr atraer a más clientes, lo que dará paso a tener una mayor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a young and active entrepreneur with a spirit for success that has motivated her to look for alternatives to get ahead.  She began offering manicure and pedicure services in the home, which she learned on her own.  This has allowed her to generate income to support her household.  She has steady customers, mainly friends and family.

She is asking for this loan so she can continue providing services from her home and she plans to set up a beauty salon and will buy a barber chair, tools, and work supplies (scissors, iron, dryer, nail polish, etc.).  This will allow her to continue working and provide better service to her customers.

Carolina knows she has a great challenge because she must set up her business in a fixed location and she will work with lots of enthusiasm, perseverance and dedication to attract more customers, giving her the opportunity to increase her profits and stability so she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and therefore, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairs. Therefore, Faridah has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Faridah is very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Jozfeen

texts.en: Jozfeen is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) works in the construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. So, Jozfeen requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for PKR 40,000 to grow her husband's business. Her husband will use this loan to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen has successfully built her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Her husband also helps her by purchasing stock of goods from the whole sale market. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Asghri

texts.en: Asghri is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an un-stitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of her business. Asghri is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. This way, he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of increased profits, he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bill. Asghri hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en: Oygul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1979. Oygul is married and has four children. Oygul’s husband is a migrant in Russia but he doesn’t send money for the family's expenses regularly. Oygul has had her own business growing potatoes and tomatoes for more than five years. She sells her harvest in a local market. Oygul has additional income from animal husbandry. She has two milk cows. She sells milk to her neighbors. She works hard but her income is small and she lives poorly. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers because she must make a new sowing. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Foday. He is married and has four children who are 19, 16, 15 and 13 years old. In 1986, Foday established his used clothing business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000. every month from this business. He is now requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.  

Foday has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to purchase bales of used clothing  He wants to buy T-shirts (two bales @ Le 550,000), ladies blouses (two bales @ Le 700,000), skirts (two bales @ Le 650,000) and jeans jackets (one bale @ Le 1,200,000).
Foday has completed his house and has improved his business by introducing an additional item (children’s wear); but did not succeed in opening an account. He is trying to continue expanding his business.

He is hardworking and honest. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
Sanai, age 43 and the mother of two children, is a villager from the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Sanai. Both children live with her and help with family’s work as well as with the business. For the sake of her entire family, Sanai has (Paddy) rice cropping as their main source of income and works for others for a fee. It is the business that she has had for 20 years.

This is the first loan cycle for Sanai with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of this loan would be that she could improve her lifestyle.  She has formed a group of 13 to help and support each other in their businesses and in their personnel lives. As the leader of this Maa Thakurani Shg, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee. She hopes that she will get a better yield. 

The other members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities like animal raising, milk selling etc. All the group members are very happy and excited to have this loan and they are very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran, age 43, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Sughran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for his business. He intends to invest the profits expected from this loan in household needs. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for a business.

loans.name: Erkinay

texts.ru: Эркинай 31 год, замужем. Имеет одного несовершеннолетнего сына. У Эркинай среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Эркинай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается реализацией сотовых телефонов и аксессуаров, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эркинай, она смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Эркинай расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эркинай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на оптовую покупку  сотовых телефонов и аксессуаров для розничной продажи. Доходы от кредита Эркинай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем намерена отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Erkinay is 31 years old, married and has one young child. Erkinay has a secondary education and is well-regarded by her neighbors. They say she is a kind and hardworking woman. Erkinay is the main source of income for her family. Since 2000, she has sold cell phones and accessories. She started this business with 5,000 KGS. Through her hard work, Erkinay was able to develop and expand her business. Now, her business brings in about 20,000 KGS per month.  This money provides for the cost of food and household needs for the family. Ernikay uses the income to grow her business. In order to further expand her business, Erkinay has requested a loan from the Bank "Bai - Tushum" for the wholesale purchase of cell phones and accessories for retail sale. Erkinay plans to invest the income from the loan to further grow her business, and has future plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories for retail sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie’s activity is livestock and she has been photographed in front of her animal stable. The little playful dog you see in the picture follows her everywhere she goes, according to Marie. She sells raw cow's milk and baby calves at the farmer's market and she has pigs as well. Since they live in the northeast part of the country with a very cold climate, pork meat is widely used and raising pigs is a good activity, as she said. In addition, her husband has beehives in a village away from their current location in the Mirdita region.

Marie is a married mother of two children at the moment. Some years back, her oldest child at the age of 13 sadly past away due to an electrical burn in the house.

She wants to do repairs to their family home with this loan.

loans.use: to make repairs to her family home

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called 'Yehowa Akwe' and are beginning their seventh cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of three members and has a representative named Rebecca. They are into a variety of businesses including selling soft drinks, foodstuffs, plastic chair and tables, slippers and ready-made clothing.

This loan will benefit their small micro-businesses and Rebecca's too. She says that she has been with ID-Ghana for four years now through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling soft drinks and foodstuffs. She began this business seven years ago when she acquired some foodstuffs and soft drinks, which she sold to new customers who are her permanent customers now.
 
The loan is to purchase soft drinks at wholesale from the depot and to sell them later at her residence. This work allows her to generate what income she can for her household, since she is married and has a child.

When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the medical consultations and the assistance that the institution offers to them.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,400 to sustain businesses.

In the picture, one of the women is behind her co-member because she positioned herself badly in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase of soft drinks at wholesale prices

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Мээрим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мээрим занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 4 лошади, 25 овец, 18 коз, с мая по январь месяц скот отгоняют на отгонные пастбища, наемному пастуху, также у нее имеется поливная земля, на которой выращивают ячмень, эспарцет, клевер, картофель для собственного употребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээрим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины для перевозки скота.
texts.en: Meerim is 30 years old and married. She and her husband are raising one daughter. Meerim has a secondary education.  To provide income for her family, Meerim grows crops and raises livestock. She started doing this two years ago, with a purchase of cattle for 60,000 KGS. Through her hard work, today Meerim's household has 3 dairy cows, 4 horses, 25 sheep, and 18 goats. From May to January the livestock are sent to graze on distant pastures with a hired shepherd.  Meerim also has a plot of irrigated land on which she grows barley, sainfoin, clover, and potatoes for personal use and sale. She receives a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Meerim has turned to the Bank "Bai - Tushum" for a loan for the purchase of sheep for breeding.  Meerim plans to use the loan income to further increase the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to purchase vehicles for transporting livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hard working woman. She has two sons and four daughters. All of her children are studying. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a furniture shop in the community market. He manufactures furniture himself and sells it n the main market at a profitable price. He manufactures sofas, beds, chairs, tables, cupboards etc.
 
He has insufficient savings to purchase wood to complete his furniture orders. Therefore, in order to help her husband, Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase wood so he can work efficiently, which will help him to complete his customers' orders on time. Khalida prays for the success of her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase wood to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is 45 years and an active borrower with Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of four children and the person responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Yasin has been running his own motorcycle showroom for many years.

He needs to purchase new models of motor bikes and different kinds of spare parts, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not in a suitable position to buy all this merchandises for his business. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva SEP loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to purchase all the above these items for his business purpose and enable him to generate a favorable income to mange his business and personal activities.

Yasin is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new models of motorcycles and different kinds of spare parts

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents. His family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fizuli city, but now they are living in Abseron region. Rasim has been in the barber shop business for two years already. Now Rasim wants to repair the water system at his salon. Therefore he needs 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). This is his second loan. He has previously he taken out a loan from Kiva and all of his loan amount was repaid on time. Rasim says he is thankful for the help and support from the Kiva organization and the lenders.

loans.use: to repair the water system at his salon

loans.name: Saidbonui

texts.ru:
Саидбонуи 24 летняя жительница района Хуросон. Она замужем. Ее муж служит Вооруженных Силах Республики. Саидбонуи мама двух летнего ребенка. Для нее семья самая важная и дорогая в жизни.
 Саидабонуи около трех лет занимается животноводством. Ей нравиться проводить время с животными, по этой причине она выбрала данную деятельность. Саидабонуи решила расширить свою деятельность путем увеличения поголовья скота. Но для купли несколько скотов у нее нет достаточно денег. Саидабонуи просит кредит для купли скота с надеждой на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Saidbonui is 24 years old and resides in the Huroson region. She is married. Her husband is serving in the army. Saidbonui is the mother of a two year old child. For her, family is the most important and dear thing in life. For about three years, Saidabonui has been raising livestock. She likes to spend time with the animals, which is why she chose this activity. Saidabonui has decided to expand her business by increasing livestock. However, she does not have enough money to purchase several head of cattle. Saidabonui has requested a loan for the purchase of cattle and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase calves in order to expand the business and grow the amount of cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is 36 years old, is a married woman blessed with three children: ages fifteen, thirteen and nine years respectively. She runs a tailoring business, which earns her a monthly income of 60,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use it to stock and expand her tailoring business by buying fabric materials for dress making.

As a result, she will increase her income and transform the living standards of her family. She hopes to expand her business, to employ and train others.

loans.use: To buy fabric and textile materials.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en: Gavhar is 43 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are adults. Gavhar’s husband has been busy with farming business. His income is not enough to provide the family with all the necessary things. Gavhar is going to organize her own business with sewing. She can to sew women’s clothes well. She is asking for a loan of 850 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old female widow who supplements her fish selling with subsistence farming. She thanks the Kiva lenders that funded her previous loan; she manged to make extra profits and also meet her client's needs. The loan has kept her business running well without hiccups and her standards of living have also improved.

She has approached Ugafode for another loan of UGX 300,000 to buy more fish, which she hopes to repay after making profits. 
She still faces challenges such as lack of storage facilities and the perishability of products that she sells. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a deacon in church. He is married and lives with his wife and mother in Armavir. 

Together with his work in the church, Arman is also involved in farming. He keeps a greenhouse where he cultivates different types of vegetables.

Arman takes care of the greenhouse with great love and care and does his best to gather good harvest. Now, by applying for this loan, Arman asks Kiva lenders to support him with the farm.

Arman plans to use the loan to pay for materials for renovation of the greenhouse, fertilizer, tomato and cucumber seeds. The loan will be a huge support for his farm and he hopes for lenders' support.

Arman has already taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, being sure that his farm is successful enough for covering monthly payments, Arman has been approved for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials for renovation of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover) and fertilizer, tomato and cucumber seeds

loans.name: Munazza

texts.en: Munazza is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling fruit for many years. She is very enthusiastic about her business of selling fruit and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is trying hard to fulfill her family’s basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas. This will help her to consistently meet market demands. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 30-year-old married woman.  She is providing cooking services to the people of her community. Bushra enjoys making food and she has become famous in her town for proving these facilities. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends it to respective places. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. She is a responsible mother of seven children and needs to earn more to meet the daily expenses of her family members. To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of rice, along with packs of oil, spices and salt. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales. Bushra wishes to utilize her earned profit for her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, along with packs of oil, spices and salt.

loans.name: Hifza

texts.en: Hifza is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her region. She has become famous for selling high quality cloth in her community. Hifza requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season.
